feat.name: Shadow Adept

prerequisite.other: Cha or Con 13+, Ability to cast 3rd level spells and must have encountered the Shadow Current in some way.

entries: Skilled with wielding weapons that most would consider to large, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have learned to utilize the {@variantrule Shadow Current|Alteia} to cast spells. These spells are subject to all of the rules regarding the Shadow Current.
You learn the spell Shield of Shadows.

feat.name: Wield Oversized Weapon
entries: Skilled with wielding weapons that most would consider to large, you gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You can use melee weapons one size category larger than you are with, but the amount of effort it takes you to use the weapon does not change. For instance, a Large longsword (a one-handed weapon for a Large creature) is considered a two-handed weapon for a Medium creature that does not have this feat. For a Medium creature that has this feat, it is still considered a one-handed weapon. You can wield a larger finesse weapon as a finesse weapon, or a larger two-handed weapon in two hands.

feat.name: Nagamaki Master

prerequisite.other: Proficiency with the Nagamaki, Strength or Dexterity 13 or higher

entries: You gain the following benefits when you take this feat:

items: Your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1 to a maximum of 20.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with a nagamaki.
When you land an attack with a nagamaki, you may strike an additional target within 5 feet of you as a bonus action. This attack is rolled separately and deals 1d8 slashing damage.

feat.name: Combat Initiate
entries: Training your body to better prepare for battle, you gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Gain one {@filter Fighting Style|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=FS:F} of your choice that you do not already have.

items.name: Tool Proficiency & Language
items.entry: The disguise kit and two languages of your choice.

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: Disguise kit, a set of fine clothes, and a belt pouch containing 30 gp

entries.name: Feature: Name Dropping
entries: You know and have met any number of powerful people across the land--and some of them might even remember you. You might be able to wrangle minor assistance from a major figure in the campaign, at the DM's discretion. Additionally, the common folk treat you with deference, and your heritage and the stories you tell might be good for a free meal or a place to sleep.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: A farmer is one of the common people, for better or for worse. Most farmers look on their humble origins as a virtue, not a shortcoming, and their home communities remain very important to them.

rows: I will never get out of my famous parent's shadow, and no one else will ever understand this burden.
I've seen enough of the adventuring life to have realistic expectations and empathy for my peers.
Living up to my legacy will be difficult, but I'm going to do it.
I'm used to the very best in life, and that's a hard habit to break.
My parent taught me a sense of duty. I strive to uphold it, even when the odds are against me.
No one can fake a smile, a handshake, or an interested nod like I can.
I've been part of the adventuring life since I was old enough to walk. Let me explain a few things to you.
No risk is too great for the rewards of defeating my enemies... and taking their stuff.
Power. The only way to get ahead in this world is to attain power and hold onto it with all your might. (Evil)
Peace. Those who can find or make peace in the chaotic world around them have everything. (Lawful)
Fame. I've seen what fame can bring. And I'll do anything to get all that for myself. (Neutral)
Training. Hard work, sacrifice, and training lead to success - and eventually to perfection. (Any)
Anonymity. I want to be successful. And alone. With lots of guards and wards between me and everyone else in the world. (Any)
Wisdom. Material wealth is an illusion. Wisdom is the real treasure. (Good)
While my parent was out adventuring, a servant raised me, and I care about that person more than anyone.
I consider every member of my parent's former adventuring party to be family.
Despite their absences, my famous parent was kind and generous. I love them and want to make them proud.
My parent once brought a cursed magic item home. It is my obsession.
My childhood home holds all my best memories, and its upkeep is my primary concern.
Growing up, I had an imaginary friend I could always count on. That friend is still with me.
You don't know what I'm going through. You never can.
You. Fetch my cloak. And maybe rub my feet for a while.
My comrades are brave, but I must defeat this threat alone to prove my worth.
Oh, yeah, that spell? Named after my parent's best friend. Let me tell you about them.
My best days are behind me. Ahead lies only toil, pain, and death.
You have to look out for yourself. No one else will.

race.name: Human
entries: Humans have the following racial traits:

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write your regional Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues - Orc curses, Altari musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Southlanders
entries: The southlanders are descended from humans that lacked the innate magical nature of the chysti and account for roughly ninety percent of the human population in the Southlands. Within human society southlanders make up the commoner caste. Southlanders are incredibly diverse culturally and can be found in virtually every land in Alteia.

entries.name: Age
entries: Southlanders reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Skill
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Feat
entries: You gain one feat of your choice.

entries.name: Norlanders
entries: The norlanders are descended from the chysti of Elcana that sailed across the Aquinachelle Ocean into the Anberg Deeps and onto the Hjaalmaran Steppes, where they made their home in the tundra. Over time their aetheric talents faded, but they retained a faint magical spark. Norlanders are tall and broad shouldered with hair of bright and strange colors.

entries.name: Age
entries: Norlanders reach physical maturity at the same age as other humans but can live to be as old as 150.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to snowy forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Elder Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened, and magic can't be used to charm you.

entries.name: Aetheric Spark
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter Wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Naturally Skilled
entries: A norlander can choose one skill or tool proficiency. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this chosen proficiency.

entries.name: Westerlanders
entries: The westerlanders are the descendants of human people that migrated across the Great Middlesea and created sprawling empires in the plains, deserts, and grasslands of the west. Westerlanders are adaptable, fierce, and strong due to years of war with the altari of the Far West. Westerlanders are generally darkskinned and culturally diverse, from the desert peoples of Aradeen to the Empire of Rafan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Westerlanders reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Chysti
entries: The chysti are descended from the human conquerors of ancient times that had magic within their blood. Chysti make up roughly ten percent of the human population yet they occupy the noble caste of human society. They are innately gifted with magical abilities, and historically the chysti are responsible for bringing the arcane arts to Alteia thousands of years ago.

entries.name: Age
entries: Chysti reach physical maturity at about the same age as other humans, however they can live to be 250 years old. It is rumored that some chysti live even longer.

entries.name: Aetheric Senses
entries: Chysti are known for their ability to sense and perceive aetheric essences. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana} skill. Additionally, any Arcana checks you make to identify a magical effect are made with advantage.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to snowy forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Aetheric Talents
entries: Chysti are naturally gifted with magic, it resides in their blood. At a young age their first abilities manifest.
You know the {@spell mage hand} cantrip.
When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell magic missile} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell magic weapon} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

entries.name: Vitterians
entries: The vitterians are the slave people of the Far West. These descendants of enslaved chysti have been subjected to heinous alchemical experimentation as well as brutal conditions under their Aetherian altari masters. These pale humans are industrious survivors and quite adaptable.

entries.name: Age
entries: Viterrians reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than 70 years.

entries.name: Alchemically Enhanced
entries: Some altari use alchemical or scientific enhancements to push their slave human's bodies beyond the limits of nature. However, doing so came at a significant price. Your Constitution, Dexterity, or Strength score increases by 2.
However, your biology is now more susceptible to chemicals, you have vulnerability to poison damage. Additionally you have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws against poison.

entries.name: Industrious
entries: Vitterians are known for their drive and work ethic. You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Deadlanders
entries: The deadlanders comprise the descendants few humans that remained on the southern continent of Omonos during the Great Migration. The harsh and blighted land of Omonos has forged their small clans into hardy and resilient bands that eek out their survival in a land most wouldn't dare tread.

entries.name: Age
entries: Deadlanders reach adulthood in their late teens and seldom live more than 60 years.

entries.name: Blightborn
entries: Born deep in the blighted land of Omonos, you have resistance to some toxins. You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Survivor
entries: The lands of Omonos are a harsh mistress and the weak die quickly. You gain proficiency in the Survival skill.

entries.name: A People From Another World
entries: Invaders from another world, conquerors from far off planes, and destroyers of altari culture, once humans controlled the entirety of the known world, and then they ruined it. In the aftermath of the fall of Omonos and the subsequent abandonment of the tainted southern continent, much knowledge was lost and with it the key to so much of the power that the humans had once held. In the following two thousand years, humans had to learn to live and work with the other races as equals. The transition was not a smooth one, many kingdoms rose and fell before there was any semblance of stability.

entries.name: A Broad Spectrum
entries: With their penchant for migration and conquest, humans are more physically diverse than other common races. There is no typical human. An individual can stand from 5 feet to a little over 6 feet tall and weigh from 125 to 250 pounds. Human skin shades range from nearly black to very pale, and hair colors from black to blond (curly, kinky, or straight); males might sport facial hair that is sparse or thick. A lot of humans have a dash of nonhuman blood, revealing hints of altari, esunite, or other lineages. Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and rarely live even a single century.

entries.name: Variety in All Things
entries: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races. They have widely varying tastes, morals, and customs in the many different lands where they have settled. When they settle, though, they stay: they build cities to last for the ages, and great kingdoms that can persist for long centuries. An individual human might have a relatively short life span, but a human nation or culture preserves traditions with origins far beyond the reach of any single human's memory. They live fully in the present-making them well suited to the adventuring life-but also plan for the future, striving to leave a lasting legacy. Individually and as a group, humans are adaptable opportunists, and they stay alert to changing political and social dynamics.

entries.name: Lasting Institutions
entries: Where a single altari or dwarf might take on the responsibility of guarding a special location or a powerful secret, humans found sacred orders and institutions for such purposes. While dwarf clans and halfling elders pass on the ancient traditions to each new generation, human temples, governments, libraries, and codes of law fix their traditions in the bedrock of history. Humans dream of immortality, but (except for those few who seek undeath or divine ascension to escape death's clutches) they achieve it by ensuring that they will be remembered when they are gone.
Although some humans can be xenophobic, in general their societies are inclusive. Human lands welcome large numbers of nonhumans compared to the proportion of humans who live in nonhuman lands.

entries.name: Exemplars of Ambition
entries: Humans who seek adventure are the most daring and ambitious members of a daring and ambitious race. They seek to earn glory in the eyes of their fellows by amassing power, wealth, and fame. More than other people, humans champion causes rather than territories or groups.

race.name: Altari
entries: Altari have the following racial traits:

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Altari are aloof and standoffish, favoring slow action and forethought. They favor neutral alignments, but all kinds of altari can be found.

entries.name: Size
entries: Altari are tall, athletic, and lean. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write your regional Common and racial dialect of Elven.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilit forests, deep caverns, or the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Black Bones
entries: Altari have jet black fibrous bones that make them tough and resilient. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being stunned, and you have resistance against bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Phaedan
entries: The Dark Elves were the first to flee during the Chysti Invasion, leaving their home within the earth to go to the northern continent. Once there they kept travelling north until they found the lands that would come to be called Phaedan. That far north the longer nights allowed them to operate in the dark as they were accustomed to and that allowed them to exist above ground for the first time in their history. No longer confined in their complex of caverns and able to spread out, warring noble houses that were used to vying for territory gave way to fiercely competitive nocturnal trade syndicates competing for resources and profits.
Phaed are taller and stockier than most altari, with horns growing from their heads. Phaed are dark skinned, with shades of dark grey to jet black and hair of white or pastel colors.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of the attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Your darkvision has a range of 120 feet, instead of 60.

entries.name: Magitech Knowledge
entries: You are proficient with magitech rifles and pistols. Additionally, you ignore the loading property of these weapons.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an {@skill History} check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Horned Charge
entries: You can use your action to make a special attack with the horns on your head. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line that ends within 5 feet of a Large or smaller creature before you use this action, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus or take {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Danach
entries: The danach, or Sea Elves are one of the few groups that were barely impacted by the ancient invasion due to the fact that most of their major settlements exist under the sea. Cut off from the southern continent, they migrated to the northern continent. There they discovered the land that they would call Danachis and that would later become Danacia, a land of many large lakes and rivers. The large lakes offered better protection from large ocean predators and much more access to resources that needed to be acquired from dry land. As a result their population flourished there and today Sea Elves are a common sight around the waters of Alteia.
Danach are slender but tough with skin of pale blue to seafoam green and hair that is often dark blue, purple, or green. Danach have small webs between their fingers and toes.

entries.name: Friend of the Sea
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Danach Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, and {@item net|phb}.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Ildrisi
entries: Colloquially known as Wood Elves, the ildrisi are by far the most populous group of Elves in Alteia, to the point that they are what most people think of when you say Elf. Although Wood Elves can be found anywhere in Alteia, the greatest concentration of them is in the Southlands, and while their name might suggest that they would make their home in the forest, in the Southlands most Wood Elves have integrated completely into Human society.
Ildrisi are stockier and shorter than most elves, with hair of auburn, brown, blonde, or black and olive complexions. Ildrisi are known for their strength and resolve.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Ildrisi Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item scimitar|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Nadiri
entries: Called High Elves because of their connection to the Goddess Alteh the Aldiri were once the wardens of the world, guiding it peacefully. When the Chysti invaded they did not succumb quickly as the other Elves did, and for that they were punished. The Chysti all but drove the High Elves to extinction and were it not for refugees fleeing north many thousands of years ago, there might not be any High Elves left. Since then though the High Elf population has recovered, and while it doesn't compare to the Wood Elf population, the High Elf population is much more concentrated in two areas, Aetheria and Nadir. In Nadir the High Elves they established a new system of law and work to transform the desert into an oasis, resuming the old ways of tending the world.

Nadiri have olive to dark complexions and dark hair that is often black or dark brown. They are shorter and more slender than most altari. Nadiri are quiet and standoffish, but they are also shrewd traders.

entries.name: Nadiri Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item scimitar|phb}, {@item blowgun|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item net|phb}.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: Nadir sits in the middle of the northern continent and relies on trade from the north and south to get by. You can read, speak, and write one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Desert Creature
entries: Ildrisi have adapted to the extremes of cold and heat that can suddenly occur in both the harsh deserts and the mountain tunnels around their caravan routes. You gain advantage on Constitution checks and saves to avoid fatigue, exhaustion, and other ill effects from running, forced marches, starvation, thirst, and hot or cold environments.

entries.name: Amoni
entries: When the Chysti invaded, the vast majority of the altari fled north with the humans to the northern continent. The amoni did not, they stayed in their ancestral homeland and weathered the blight. They grew larger and stronger than other altari, sprouting large antlers and gaining the ability to speak with beasts and plants. Over time, they gained some limited immunity to the effects of the blight, and slowly they began to explore the ruins of the ancient Chysti cities that lay strewn about the lands of Omonos.

Amoni are larger than other altari with large antlers. Their skin tones can vary wildly, from blues to purples to greens, as well as more normal skin tones. Amoni hair colors vary equally, making them look quite strange and exotic.

entries.name: Amoni Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longspear}, {@item shortspear}, {@item longbow|phb}, and {@item shortbow|phb}.

entries.name: Blightborn
entries: Born in the blighted land of Omonos, you have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts and plants. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Eld
entries: The eld are the ancient ancestors of the altari. While none exist on Alteia, they have a thriving civilization in the Feywild that acts as watchers and defenders of the Material Planes. Eld are isolationist, and very few have ever been seen on Alteia in the current Age, instead preferring to stay in the Feywild and watch the progression of events from afar.

Eld are tall, slender, and beautiful. They have an almost magical draw to them. Their skin seems to sparkle in bright light, and their hair is light and airy, fluttering at the slightest wind. Their skin and hair tones vary wildly, they can be almost any color.

entries.name: Child of Light
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Ethereal Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can step through the Ethereal Plane, teleporting up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entries.name: Keen Sense
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Aetherian
entries: Called High Elves because of their connection to the Goddess Alteh the Aldiri were once the wardens of the world, guiding it peacefully. When the Chysti invaded they did not succumb quickly as the other Elves did, and for that they were punished. The Chysti all but drove the High Elves to extinction and were it not for refugees fleeing north many thousands of years ago, there might not be any High Elves left. Since then though the High Elf population has recovered, and while it doesn't compare to the Wood Elf population, the High Elf population is much more concentrated in two areas, Aetheria and Nadir. In Aetheria, the aetheri have formed a highly efficient holy empire bent on returning the world to the hands of their goddess.

Aetheri are tall, bronze skinned altari with hair of gold or light brown, and occasionally black. Aetheri are stern and severe and hold a deep hatred for humans of all types, even keeping them as slaves.

entries.name: Aetherian Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item longbow|phb}, and {@item shortbow|phb}.

entries.name: Imperial Lore
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill History} skill.

entries.name: Alchemic Enhancement
entries: Lacking magical talents, aetheri adventurers use alchemical or scientific enhancements to push their bodies beyond the limits of nature. However, doing so comes at a significant price.

You gain a +2 racial bonus to your Strength, Constitution, or Dexterity score. However, your biology is now more susceptible to chemicals, causing you to suffer disadvantage on saving throws against poison.

entries.name: Aseni
entries: The green depths of the Shinakinas Timberlands hide an ancient secret long forgotten by folk beyond its borders, and not widely known even within - the Aseni, an altari subrace that retreated from Alteia to extraplanar refuges known as Sildëyuir and the Court of Stars. Sometimes referred to in ancient texts as nethryl altari, the star elves concealed the existence of their hidden kingdom for almost two thousand years, leaving behind nothing but mysterious ruins and old, strong magic in the stone circles of the Shinakinas.

The Aseni, also known as Star or Twilight elves live in outer realms of the Feywild the Court of Stars although they once hailed from Alteia. It is a little known fact that the Aseni were the first race of Altari to walk the world of Alteia. While the star elves have kept themselves apart from the rest of Alteia for many centuries, their isolation is coming to an end. Besieged by an insidious peril from beyond their circles of the world, they face the possibility of being driven from their extraplanar homes back to their ancient abode in Shinakinas.

The Aseni have extremely delicate skin seemingly made of stars, and silver, white or lavender hair. Their eyes tend to be silver, golden, grey or soft tints of lavender and violet with gold or white flecks in them. They often have curved horns or antlers and their hands only have three fingers and a thumb.

entries.name: Extraplanar
entries: Star Elves are not native to this world. Spells such as banishment will return you to your native realm of Sildëyuir or the Court of Stars. Your native realm is chosen at character creation and cannot be changed.

entries.name: Insightful
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill Insight} skill.

entries.name: Keen Sense
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: The Sight
entries: You know a {@filter Divination cantrip|spells|school=divination|level=0} of your choice.
When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the spell {@spell detect magic} once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Aseni
entries: The green depths of the Shinakinas Timberlands hide an ancient secret long forgotten by folk beyond its borders, and not widely known even within - the Aseni, an altari subrace that retreated from Alteia to extraplanar refuges known as Sildëyuir and the Court of Stars. Sometimes referred to in ancient texts as nethryl altari, the star elves concealed the existence of their hidden kingdom for almost two thousand years, leaving behind nothing but mysterious ruins and old, strong magic in the stone circles of the Shinakinas.

The Aseni, also known as Star or Twilight elves live in outer realms of the Feywild the Court of Stars although they once hailed from Alteia. It is a little known fact that the Aseni were the first race of Altari to walk the world of Alteia. While the star elves have kept themselves apart from the rest of Alteia for many centuries, their isolation is coming to an end. Besieged by an insidious peril from beyond their circles of the world, they face the possibility of being driven from their extraplanar homes back to their ancient abode in Shinakinas.

The Aseni have extremely delicate skin seemingly made of stars, and silver, white or lavender hair. Their eyes tend to be silver, golden, grey or soft tints of lavender and violet with gold or white flecks in them. They often have curved horns or antlers and their hands only have three fingers and a thumb.

entries.name: Extraplanar
entries: Star Elves are not native to this world. Spells such as banishment will return you to your native realm of Sildëyuir or the Court of Stars. Your native realm is chosen at character creation and cannot be changed.

entries.name: Keen Sense
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Otherworldly Touch
entries: As a bonus action, you can confer your otherworldly touch to one melee weapon. This object becomes magical if it wasn't already, and you may use your Charisma for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon. This effect lasts for 1 minute, or until you are no longer wielding the weapon.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, regaining expended uses on a long rest.

race.name: Half-Altari
entries: Half-Altari have the following racial traits:

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Half-elves share the chaotic bent of their elven heritage. They value both personal freedom and creative expression, demonstrating neither love of leaders nor desire for followers. They chafe at rules, resent others' demands, and sometimes prove unreliable, or at least unpredictable.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-elves mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live much longer than humans, however, often exceeding 180 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-elves are about the same size as humans, making your size Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your elf blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. Yon can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Elder Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened, and magic can't charm you.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Half-Altari
entries: Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, half-altari (called half-elves) combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents: human curiosity, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of nature, and artistic tastes of the elves. Some half-elves live among humans, set apart by their emotional and physical differences, watching friends and loved ones age while time barely touches them. Others live with the elves, growing to adulthood while their peers continue to live as children, growing restless in the timeless elven realms. Many half-elves, unable to fit into either society, choose lives of solitary wandering or join with other misfits and outcasts in the adventuring life.

entries.name: Of Two Worlds
entries: To humans, half-elves look like elves, and to elves, they look human. In height, they're on par with both parents, though they're neither as slender as elves nor as broad as humans. They range from under 5 feet to about 6 feet tall, and from 100 to 180 pounds, with men only slightly taller and heavier than women. Half-elf men do have facial hair, and sometimes grow beards to mask their elven ancestry. Half-elven coloration and features lie, somewhere between their human and elf parents, and thus show a variety even more pronounced than that found among either race. They tend to have the eyes of their elven parents.

entries.name: Diplomats or Wanderers
entries: Half-elves have no lands of their own, though they are welcome in human cities and somewhat less welcome in elven forests. In large cities in regions where elves and humans interact often, half-elves are sometimes numerous enough to form small communities of their own. They enjoy the company of other half-elves, the only people who truly understand what it is to live between these two worlds.

In most parts of the world, though, half-elves are uncommon enough that one might live for years without meeting another. Some prefer to avoid company altogether, wandering the wilds as foresters, hunters, or adventurers and visiting civilization only rarely. Like elves, they are driven by the wanderlust that comes of their longevity. Others, in contrast, throw themselves into the thick of society, putting their charisma and social skills to great use in diplomatic roles or as swindlers.

entries.name: Half-Altari Names
entries: Half-elves use either human or elven naming conventions. As if to emphasize that they don't really fit in to either society, half- elves raised among humans are often given elven names, and those raised among elves often take human names.

entries.name: Excellent Ambassadors
entries: Many half-elves learn at an early age to get along with everyone, defusing hostility and finding common ground. As a race, they have elves grace without elves aloofness and human energy without human boorishness. They often make excellent ambassadors and go-betweens (except between elves and humans, since each side suspects the half-elf of favoring the other).

reward.name: Lycanthropy, Werebear
entries: Upon being infected with Lycanthropy, the corresponding Lycanthropy trait can be applied, you gain the following:

items: Your Constitution Score increases by 1.

Shapechanger. You can use an action to polymorph into a Large Bear-Humanoid hybrid or into a Large Bear, or back into your true form. Your statistics, other than size and AC are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You revert back to your true form if you die.

Bear-Humanoid Hybrid Form and Bear Form. Your size is Medium. You have natural armour equal to 11 + Constitution Modifier. You gain a climb speed of 30ft. You gain the Bite attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 1d8}+Strength piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 + Constitution Modifier, Constitution Saving Throw or be cursed with werebear lycanthropy. You gain the Claw attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 2d4}+Strength slashing damage.

reward.name: Lycanthropy, Werewolf
entries: Upon being infected with Lycanthropy, the corresponding Lycanthropy trait can be applied, you gain the following:

items: Your Strength Score increases by 1.

Shapechanger. You can use an action to polymorph into a Medium Wolf-Humanoid hybrid or into a Medium Wolf, or back into your true form. Your statistics, other than size and AC are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You revert back to your true form if you die.

Wolf-Humanoid Hybrid Form. Your size is Medium. You have natural armour equal to 11 + Dexterity Modifier. You gain the Bite attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 1d8}+Strength piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 + Constitution Modifier, Constitution Saving Throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy. You gain the Claw attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 2d4}+Strength slashing damage.
Keen Hearing and Smell. While in your Wolf-Humanoid Hybrid form, or your Wolf form, gain advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on hearing or smell.

reward.name: Lycanthropy, Weretiger
entries: Upon being infected with Lycanthropy, the corresponding Lycanthropy trait can be applied, you gain the following:

items: Your Dexterity Score increases by 1.

Shapechanger. You can use an action to polymorph into a Medium Tiger-Humanoid hybrid or into a Medium Tiger, or back into your true form. Your statistics, other than size and AC are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You revert back to your true form if you die.

Tiger-Humanoid Hybrid Form and Tiger Form. Your size is Medium. You have natural armour equal to 12 + Dexterity Modifier. You gain the Bite attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 1d8}+Dexterity piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 + Constitution Modifier, Constitution Saving Throw or be cursed with weretiger lycanthropy.You gain the Claw attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 1d6}+Dexterity slashing damage. If you move at least 15 feet straight towards a target and then hit it with a Claws attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a DC 10 + Dexterity Modifier, Strength Saving Throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, you can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

reward.name: Lycanthropy, Wererat
entries: Upon being infected with Lycanthropy, the corresponding Lycanthropy trait can be applied, you gain the following:

items: Your Dexterity Score increases by 1.

Shapechanger. You can use an action to polymorph into a medium Rat-Humanoid hybrid or into a small Rat, or back into your true form. Your statistics, other than size and AC are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You revert back to your true form if you die.

Rat-Humanoid Hybrid Form. Your size is Medium. You have natural armour equal to 11 + Dexterity Modifier. You gain the Bite attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 1d6}+Dexterity piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 + Constitution Modifier, Constitution Saving Throw or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy.
Keen Smell. While in your Rat-Humanoid Hybrid form, gain advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on smell.

reward.name: Lycanthropy, Wereboar
entries: Upon being infected with Lycanthropy, the corresponding Lycanthropy trait can be applied, you gain the following:

items: Your Strength Score increases by 1.

Shapechanger. You can use an action to polymorph into a medium Boar-Humanoid hybrid or into a medium Boar, or back into your true form. Your statistics, other than size and AC are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You revert back to your true form if you die.

Boar-Humanoid Hybrid Form and Boar Form. Your size is Medium. You have natural armour equal to 11 + Strength Modifier. You gain the Tusks attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 1d6}+Strength piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 + Constitution Modifier, Constitution Saving Throw or be cursed with wereboar lycanthropy. You gain the Maul attack and are considered proficient: Melee Weapon Attack, one target, {@dice 1d8}+Strength slashing damage. If you move at least 15 feet straight towards a target and then hit it with your Tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 10 + Strength Modifier, Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reward.name: Chysti Augmentations, Combat
entries: Upon recieving their Alteration or Augmentation, the corresponding trait can be applied, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength, Dexterity and Constitution scores are increased by 1.
Your height increases by 1 foot and your weight is tripled.

You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness. However, you can only see in tones of one color. This may be violet, yellow, magenta, green, blue, teal, red, or orange.
You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.
You have been rendered sterile.

reward.name: Chysti Augmentations, Arcane
entries: Upon recieving their Alteration or Augmentation, the corresponding trait can be applied, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma scores are increased by 1.
You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.
You have been rendered sterile.

entries: Additionally, you can gather the ambient aether in the air, restoring some of your energy. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose up to expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than 3.

reward.name: Akaran Alterations, Compression
entries: Upon recieving their Alteration or Augmentation, the corresponding trait can be applied, you gain the following benefits:

You gain the ability to compress the aether of your spells, empowering them. When casting a spell, you can spend an additional spell slot of 1st level to increase the DC of its saving throw by 1. Once you have used this ability, it cannot be used again until you complete a short or long rest.

reward.name: Akaran Alterations, Manipulation
entries: Upon recieving their Alteration or Augmentation, the corresponding trait can be applied, you gain the following benefits:
You gain a limited ability to cast spells. You learn one cantrip and one 1st level spell of the DM's choice.

reward.name: Akaran Alterations, Ablation
entries: Upon recieving their Alteration or Augmentation, the corresponding trait can be applied, you gain the following benefits:
One negative trait that your character possesses is removed.
For example, if you have the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, you can choose to no longer suffer the penalties from it.

reward.name: Akaran Alterations, Combination
entries: Upon recieving their Alteration or Augmentation, the corresponding trait can be applied, you gain the following benefits:
Your soul and mind have been merged with those of a person from an ancient time.
This is similar to a sentient magic item that is always with you. Work with your DM to create the persona of the being with whom you have been combined.

reward.name: Essence, Storms
entries: Many of the gods were shattered and their essences scattered across the Material Planes by Ordinus as a punishment. In what seemed at first like a meteor shower, you were struck by one of these fragments of numina.
You posses a fragment of the numina of Idros the Stormborn, chysti god of storms. This essence grants you the following abilities:

entries.name: Call Lightning
entries: You can cast {@spell call lightning} with this trait, requiring no material components. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way until you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Immortal Essence
entries: You cease to age and are no longer affected by the passage of time. You must still seek nourishment as normal. However, if you are killed, as long as your body is intact, you return to life with 1 hit point in {@dice 1d8}+1 minutes. If your body is destroyed or damaged beyond repair, then you are reformed {@dice 1d4} days later at the place you died at which time the pieces of your previous body fade into motes of light.

entries.name: Focused Regeneration
entries: {@i 5th-level Essence trait}
You have gained the ability to focus the regenerative nature of your Essence and can use it to heal yourself.

You regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} plus your character level. Additionally, if you concentrate on maintaining the effect, you can regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns for 1 hour. If you concentrate for the full duration, any severed limbs are restored over the course of the next {@dice 1d4}+1 days. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the spell causes the limb to knit to the stump over the course of the hour.

entries.name: Stormborn
entries: {@i 11th-level Essence trait}
You gain resistance to thunder and lightning damage.

entries.name: Stormlord
entries: {@i 17th-level Essence trait}

You can cast {@spell chain lightning} and {@spell lightning storm} with this trait, requiring no material components. Once you cast one of these spells, you can't cast it in this way until you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries: Many of the gods were shattered and their essences scattered across the Material Planes by Ordinus as a punishment. In what seemed at first like a meteor shower, you were struck by one of these fragments of numina.
You posses a fragment of the numina of Orua the Mistress of Magic, altari goddess of magic and secrets. This essence grants you the following abilities:

entries: You gain advantage on any skill check to which you are opposed.

entries.name: Keen Mind
entries: {@i 11th-level Essence trait}

items: Increase your Intelligence score by 1.
You always know which way is north.
You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.
You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.

entries.name: Keen Intellect
entries: {@i 17th-level Essence trait}

items: Increase your Intelligence score by 1.
You can recall anything you've seen or heard within a number of weeks equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Once per long rest you can gain advantage on any Intelligence-based skill check.
By discussing a problem with your allies, you can turn any Insight or Investigation check into a group skill check.

items: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1.
You gain expertise in the Arcana skill.

entries.name: Magic Initiate
entries: {@i 11th-level Essence trait}

items: Choose a class: {@filter bard|spells|level=0;1|class=bard}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=cleric}, {@filter druid|spells|level=0;1|class=druid}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0;1|class=sorcerer}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=0;1|class=warlock}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=wizard}. You learn two cantrips of your choice from that class's spell list.

In addition, choose one 1st-level spell from that same list. You learn that spell and can cast it at its lowest level. Once you cast it, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again using this feat.

Your spellcasting ability for these spells depends on the class you chose: Charisma for {@filter bard|spells|level=0;1|class=bard}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0;1|class=sorcerer}, or {@filter warlock|spells|level=0;1|class=warlock}; Wisdom for {@filter cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=cleric} or {@filter druid|spells|level=0;1|class=druid}; or Intelligence for {@filter wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=wizard}.

entries.name: Magic Adept
entries: {@i 17th-level Essence trait}

Choose one spell of 2nd level, 3rd level, 4th level, and 5th level from the {@filter bard|spells|level=2;3;4;5|class=bard}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=2;3;4;5|class=cleric}, {@filter druid|spells|level=2;3;4;5|class=druid}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=2;3;4;5|class=sorcerer}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=2;3;4;5|class=warlock}, and {@filter wizard|spells|level=2;3;4;5|class=wizard} spell lists. You gain the ability to cast these spells without material components. Once you cast one of these spells, you can't cast it in this way until you finish a long rest. You may choose Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma to be your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries: You grow pale and sickly. Your type changes to undead. You are immune to the effects of turn undead although it does make your skin crawl. You gain normal benefits from healing but you are vulnerable to radiant damage. Additionally, when you receive necrotic damage you take no damage and are instead healed for half of the amount of damage dealt.

entries.name: The Leader
entries: If you spend at least 5 minutes giving a rousing speech you can make a Charisma or Performance check with a DC of 15. If you succeed, all allies within 30' gain 5 temporary hit points. If you succeed with a DC of 20 or better, this bonus increases to 10 temporary hit points.

Additionally, if you spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier. A creature can't gain temporary hit points from this feature again until it has finished a short or long rest.

entries: {@i 17th-level Essence trait}

You gain the ability to truly inspire others to follow your leadership. As a bonus action you can grant an ally within 60 feet of you a d20 inspiration die that they can add to an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you have used this ability you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries: Many of the gods were shattered and their essences scattered across the Material Planes by Ordinus as a punishment. In what seemed at first like a meteor shower, you were struck by one of these fragments of numina.
You posses a fragment of the numina of Aostrad the God Emperor, chysti god of thunder, the skies, and war. This essence grants you the following abilities:

entries.name: Weapon Master
entries: Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with four weapons of your choice. Each one must be a simple or a martial weapon.

entries.name: Immortal Essence
entries: You cease to age and are no longer affected by the passage of time. You must still seek nourishment as normal. However, if you are killed, as long as your body is intact, you return to life with 1 hit point in {@dice 1d8}+1 minutes. If your body is destroyed or damaged beyond repair, then you are reformed {@dice 1d4} days later at the place you died at which time the pieces of your previous body fade into motes of light.

entries.name: Focused Regeneration
entries: {@i 5th-level Essence trait}
You have gained the ability to focus the regenerative nature of your Essence and can use it to heal yourself.

You regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} plus your character level. Additionally, if you concentrate on maintaining the effect, you can regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns for 1 hour. If you concentrate for the full duration, any severed limbs are restored over the course of the next {@dice 1d4}+1 days. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the spell causes the limb to knit to the stump over the course of the hour.

entries.name: Tandem Tactician

entries.name: Hands of the Hospitaler
entries: Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your character level x3. As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in your pool.

This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.

entries: {@i 5th-level Essence trait}
You have gained the ability to focus the regenerative nature of your Essence and can use it to heal yourself.

You regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} plus your character level. Additionally, if you concentrate on maintaining the effect, you can regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns for 1 hour. If you concentrate for the full duration, any severed limbs are restored over the course of the next {@dice 1d4}+1 days. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the spell causes the limb to knit to the stump over the course of the hour.

entries.name: Shadow Adept
entries: {@i 11th-level Essence trait}
Increase your Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have learned to utilize the Shadow Current to cast spells. These spells are subject to all of the rules regarding the Shadow Current.
You learn the spell {@spell shield of shadows|Alteia}.

entries.name: Saber of Shadows
entries: {@i 17th-level Essence trait}

You can cast {@spell Sairis' saber of shadows|Alteia} with this trait, requiring no material components. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

reward.name: Essence, Animals
entries: Many of the gods were shattered and their essences scattered across the Material Planes by Ordinus as a punishment. In what seemed at first like a meteor shower, you were struck by one of these fragments of numina.
You posses a fragment of the numina of Rong the Magnificent, the dragon god of truth and insight. This essence grants you the following abilities:

entries.name: Beastwhisper
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

entries.name: Immortal Essence
entries: You cease to age and are no longer affected by the passage of time. You must still seek nourishment as normal. However, if you are killed, as long as your body is intact, you return to life with 1 hit point in {@dice 1d8}+1 minutes. If your body is destroyed or damaged beyond repair, then you are reformed {@dice 1d4} days later at the place you died at which time the pieces of your previous body fade into motes of light.

entries: {@i 11th-level Essence trait}
You gain the Wild Shape ability as if you were a druid of your total character level.

entries.name: Dominate Beasts

entries.name: Tracker
entries: Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn the {@spell hunter's mark} spell. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
You have advantage on {@skill Survival} checks to track creatures.

item.name: The Black Wind
entries: This longsword is no ordinary blade. Heralded by storms and a winged harbinger, the Black Wind is the image of an ancient sword, with a short but elegant crossguard and a wide blade made of pure black crystal.

entries.name: Crystalline Light
entries: In darkness, the unsheathed blade of this sword sheds moonlight, creating bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

entries.name: The Blade That Is All Blades
entries: The blade is imbued with illusion magic, allowing its bearer to alter the item's appearance in minor ways. Such alterations don't change how the item is worn, carried, or wielded, and they have no effect on its other magical properties. For example, the wearer could make the sword appear to be a different style, or the blade appear to be made of a different material. The item reverts to its true appearance when no one is carrying or wearing it.

item.name: True Rune, TEMPLATE
entries: The inside of this Rune swirls with black and red arcane energies, and you swear you can almost see a sword appear and fade. The Black Sword Rune is a wild and unpredictable being that is only interested in combat. While legends and myths have given it the name Black Sword, it may be more correct to consider it the True Rune of War.
Alignment: True Neutral
Statistics: INT 20, WIS 15, CHA 30

entries.name: Bound State
entries: The item communicates by transmitting emotion to the creating carrying or wielding it. Hearing and normal vision to 30 ft.

entries.name: Awakened State
entries: The item can speak, read, and understand one or more Languages. Hearing and normal vision to 60 ft.

entries.name: Empowered State
entries: The item can speak, read, and understand all Languages. In addition, the item can communicate telepathically the wielder. Hearing and {@sense darkvision} to 60 ft.

entries.name: Enlightened State
entries: The item can communicate telepathically with any character within 100ft the wielder. Hearing and {@sense darkvision} to 120 ft.

entries.name: Information
entries: The item is convinced that it and its wielder have key roles to play in future events.

A sentient item has a will of its own, shaped by its personality and Alignment. If its wielder acts in a manner opposed to the item's Alignment or purpose, conflict can arise. When such a conflict occurs, the item makes a Charisma check contested by the wielder's Charisma check. If the item wins the contest, it demands that its wielder pursue the item's goals to the exclusion of all other goals. If its wielder refuses to comply with the item's wishes, the item can do the following:
Suppress one or more of its activated properties or attempt to take control of its wielder.

If a sentient item attempts to take control of its wielder, the wielder must make a Charisma Saving Throw, with a DC equal to 12 + the item's Charisma modifier. On a failed save, the wielder is Charmed by the item for {@dice 1d12} hours. While Charmed, the wielder must try to follow the item's commands. If the wielder takes damage, it can repeat the Saving Throw, ending the effect on a success. Whether the attempt to control its user succeeds or fails, the item can't use this power again until the next dawn.

item.name: Rune of TEMPLATE
entries: Magical crystals that brim with aether, Runes range from tiny shards known as Ioun Stones to the Mother Crystals, gigantic crystalline structures the size of cities buried deep under the earth. The Runes are powerful magical relics of a cataclysm that took place in a forgotten Age and respected scholars and runicologists have suggested that even the weakest of Runes are actually living beings rather than hunks of crystal.

item.name: Rune, Lesser
entries: Magical crystals that brim with aether, Runes range from tiny shards known as Ioun Stones to the Mother Crystals, gigantic crystalline structures the size of cities buried deep under the earth. The Runes are powerful magical relics of a cataclysm that took place in a forgotten Age and respected scholars and runicologists have suggested that even the weakest of Runes are actually living beings rather than hunks of crystal.
This Rune may be recharged with up to three 1st level spells.

item.name: Rune, Minor
entries: Magical crystals that brim with aether, Runes range from tiny shards known as Ioun Stones to the Mother Crystals, gigantic crystalline structures the size of cities buried deep under the earth. The Runes are powerful magical relics of a cataclysm that took place in a forgotten Age and respected scholars and runicologists have suggested that even the weakest of Runes are actually living beings rather than hunks of crystal.
This Rune may be recharged with up to three 2nd level and one 3rd level spells.

item.name: Rune, Greater
entries: Magical crystals that brim with aether, Runes range from tiny shards known as Ioun Stones to the Mother Crystals, gigantic crystalline structures the size of cities buried deep under the earth. The Runes are powerful magical relics of a cataclysm that took place in a forgotten Age and respected scholars and runicologists have suggested that even the weakest of Runes are actually living beings rather than hunks of crystal.

This rune stores spells cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The rune can store up to 7 levels worth of spells at a time. When found, it contains 1d8 - 1 levels of stored spells.

Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 7th level into the rune by touching the rune as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the rune. If the rune can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

While weilding this rune, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the rune is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

item.name: Rune, Master
entries: Magical crystals that brim with aether, Runes range from tiny shards known as Ioun Stones to the Mother Crystals, gigantic crystalline structures the size of cities buried deep under the earth. The Runes are powerful magical relics of a cataclysm that took place in a forgotten Age and respected scholars and runicologists have suggested that even the weakest of Runes are actually living beings rather than hunks of crystal.

This rune stores spells cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The rune can store up to 9 levels worth of spells at a time. When found, it contains 1d10 - 1 levels of stored spells.

Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 9th level into the rune by touching the rune as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the rune. If the rune can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses

While weilding this rune, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the rune is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

item.name: Weapon Empowerment Rune of Force, +1
entries: Magical crystals that brim with aether, Runes range from tiny shards known as Ioun Stones to the Mother Crystals, gigantic crystalline structures the size of cities buried deep under the earth. The Runes are powerful magical relics of a cataclysm that took place in a forgotten Age and respected scholars and runicologists have suggested that even the weakest of Runes are actually living beings rather than hunks of crystal.
A strangle swirling vortex of energy rests inside this Rune, and while it doesn't feel as though you could cast a spell using the energy, it does feel as though its power could be put to other uses.
This Rune can be used to permanently empower a weapon with a +1 magical bonus or add an additional 1d6 force damage on hit.

item.name: Spellshard Rune
entries: Magical crystals that brim with aether, Runes range from tiny shards known as Ioun Stones to the Mother Crystals, gigantic crystalline structures the size of cities buried deep under the earth. The Runes are powerful magical relics of a cataclysm that took place in a forgotten Age and respected scholars and runicologists have suggested that even the weakest of Runes are actually living beings rather than hunks of crystal.
A strangle swirling vortex of energy rests inside this Rune, and while it doesn't feel as though you could cast a spell using the energy, it does feel as though its power could be put to other uses.
This Rune can be used to permanently empower a weapon with a +1 magical bonus or add an additional 1d6 force damage on hit.

item.name: Runic Gauntlet, Omonosian
entries: An extremely elaborate black gauntlet trimmed in pristine silver with five small sockets on the back of the hand that appear as though Runes might fit into them.
Up to five Runes may be socketed into this gauntlet. When the wearer uses a Rune in the gauntlet to cast a spell, the action cost of the spell is reduced according to the table below:
Placing a Rune in the guantlet requires one hour as you attune to the energies inside the Rune to enable faster casting.
Removing a Rune from the gauntlet requires one minute as you let your attunement to the energies inside the Rune fade away.

item.name: Runic Gauntlet, Azerian
entries: An elaborate crimson gauntlet trimmed in gold with three small sockets on the back of the hand that appear as though Runes might fit into them.
Up to three Runes may be socketed into this gauntlet. When the wearer uses a Rune in the gauntlet to cast a spell, the action cost of the spell is reduced according to the table below:
Placing a Rune in the guantlet requires one hour as you attune to the energies inside the Rune to enable faster casting.
Removing a Rune from the gauntlet requires one minute as you let your attunement to the energies inside the Rune fade away.

item.name: Chysti Light Power Armor
entries: This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit. Additionally, you have resistance to psychic damage while you wear this armor.

item.name: Chysti Heavy Power Armor
entries: This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit. Additionally, you have resistance to one type of damage while you wear this armor. During a long rest, the type of damage may be reconfigured.

item.name: Maktigsvard
entries: The pommel of this fine weapon is set with three clear gemstones and is bound in fine green leather.

entries.name: Indomitable
entries: If the sword is on your person, you can call on its indomitability (no action required) to reroll one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. You must use the second roll. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: The Watcher's Longbow
entries: This weapon is made of some rare materials and has engravings of watching eyes and rising suns all over it.

entries.name: Alertness
entries: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

item.name: Rossettont
entries: This weapon is made of some rare materials and has engravings of watching eyes and rising suns all over it.

entries.name: Vicious
entries: When you roll a 20 on your attack roll with this magic weapon, your critical hit deals an extra 7 damage of the weapon's type.

item.name: True Rune, the Black Sword
entries: The inside of this Rune swirls with black and red arcane energies, and you swear you can almost see a sword appear and fade. The Black Sword Rune is a wild and unpredictable being that is only interested in combat. While legends and myths have given it the name Black Sword, it may be more correct to consider it the True Rune of War.
Alignment: Chaotic Neutral
Statistics: INT 20, WIS 15, CHA 30

entries.name: Bound State
entries: The item communicates by transmitting emotion to the creating carrying or wielding it. Hearing and normal vision to 30 ft.
You may cast the {@spell Blade Ward} cantrip at will.
You may cast {@spell Shadow Blade} once per day. This spell uses the Concentration slot of the True Rune and not the bearer.

entries.name: Awakened State
entries: The item can speak, read, and understand one or more Languages. Hearing and normal vision to 60 ft.
You may cast the {@spell Booming Blade} and {@spell Sword Burst} cantrips at will.

entries.name: Empowered State
entries: The item can speak, read, and understand all Languages. In addition, the item can communicate telepathically the wielder. Hearing and {@sense darkvision} to 60 ft.

You may cast Darkness once per day. This spell uses the Concentration slot of the True Rune and not the bearer. Additionally, not even blindsight or truesight can percieve the interior of the darkness, only the bearer of the True Rune can see inside this area of magical darkness.
You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

entries.name: Enlightened State
entries: The item can communicate telepathically with any character within 100ft the wielder. Hearing and {@sense darkvision} to 120 ft.

The True Rune gains two charges of the {@spell Maddening Darkness|XGE} spell. After the effects of the spell finish, the wielder becomes exhausted {@dice 2d4+1} rounds later as time catches up to them and this exhaustion persists for 24 hours and cannot be removed by any means other than an extended rest.

entries.name: Information
entries: The item is convinced that it and its wielder have key roles to play in future events.

A sentient item has a will of its own, shaped by its personality and Alignment. If its wielder acts in a manner opposed to the item's Alignment or purpose, conflict can arise. When such a conflict occurs, the item makes a Charisma check contested by the wielder's Charisma check. If the item wins the contest, it demands that its wielder pursue the item's goals to the exclusion of all other goals. If its wielder refuses to comply with the item's wishes, the item can do the following:
Suppress one or more of its activated properties or attempt to take control of its wielder.

If a sentient item attempts to take control of its wielder, the wielder must make a Charisma Saving Throw, with a DC equal to 12 + the item's Charisma modifier. On a failed save, the wielder is Charmed by the item for {@dice 1d12} hours. While Charmed, the wielder must try to follow the item's commands. If the wielder takes damage, it can repeat the Saving Throw, ending the effect on a success. Whether the attempt to control its user succeeds or fails, the item can't use this power again until the next dawn.

item.name: True Rune, Lightning and Thunder
entries: The inside of the True Rune of Lightning and Thunder is a roiling storm of crackling blue and white energy. Although good at heart, the True Rune of Lightning and Thunder is a volatile spirit that prefers the thunderous chaos of storms to inane speech with mortals.
Alignment: Chaotic Good
Statistics: INT 15, WIS 20, CHA 30

entries.name: Bound State
entries: The item communicates by transmitting emotion to the creating carrying or wielding it. Hearing and normal vision to 30 ft.
You may cast the {@spell Thunderclap} cantrip at will.
You may cast {@spell Thunderwave} once per day.

entries.name: Awakened State
entries: The item can speak, read, and understand one or more Languages. Hearing and normal vision to 60 ft.
You may cast {@spell Thunder Step} once per day.

entries.name: Empowered State
entries: The item can speak, read, and understand all Languages. In addition, the item can communicate telepathically the wielder. Hearing and {@sense darkvision} to 60 ft.
You may cast {@spell Lightning Bolt} once per day.

entries.name: Enlightened State
entries: The item can communicate telepathically with any character within 100ft the wielder. Hearing and {@sense darkvision} to 120 ft.

The True Rune gains one charge of the {@spell Storm of Vengeance} spell. After the effects of the spell finish, the wielder becomes exhausted {@dice 2d4+1} rounds later as time catches up to them and this exhaustion persists for 24 hours and cannot be removed by any means other than an extended rest.

entries.name: Information
entries: The item is convinced that it and its wielder have key roles to play in future events.

When such a conflict occurs, the item makes a Charisma check contested by the wielder's Charisma check. If the item wins the contest, it demands that its wielder pursue the item's goals to the exclusion of all other goals. If its wielder refuses to comply with the item's wishes, the item can do the following:
Suppress one or more of its activated properties or attempt to take control of its wielder.

If a sentient item attempts to take control of its wielder, the wielder must make a Charisma Saving Throw, with a DC equal to 12 + the item's Charisma modifier. On a failed save, the wielder is Charmed by the item for {@dice 1d12} hours. While Charmed, the wielder must try to follow the item's commands. If the wielder takes damage, it can repeat the Saving Throw, ending the effect on a success. Whether the attempt to control its user succeeds or fails, the item can't use this power again until the next dawn.

item.name: True Rune, Ice and Frost
entries: The True Rune of Ice and Frost glows a faint white and is extremely cold to touch. The True Rune of Ice and Frost is a quiet and serene persona, though a great power lies within this True Rune. An ancient legend says that the Phaedani Nightlands were created for them by this very Rune.
Alignment: Neutral Good
Statistics: INT 30, WIS 20, CHA 15

entries.name: Bound State
entries: The item communicates by transmitting emotion to the creating carrying or wielding it. Hearing and normal vision to 30 ft.
You may cast the {@spell Ray of Frost} cantrip at will.
You may cast {@spell Ice Knife} once per day.

entries.name: Empowered State

entries: The True Rune of Water and Waves is a joyful and bubbly soul that commands the seas. Pirates have legends about mermaids stealing this Rune from the hand of its wielder and carrying it away to the briny depths although the Rune itself would tell you a different story.

Statistics: INT 20, WIS 30, CHA 15

entries: The True Rune of Earth and Stone is a stoic and unmoving spirit. The Rune is persistent, strict, and unwavering, though it can be a stalwart ally if it is treated well by its host. entries: The Wild Beast Rune is a savage and surly soul, like a rugged old wolf on the hunt. Wielding this Rune is akin to taming a wild stallion, a constant and dangerous battle of wills. Legend has it that previous wielders of this Rune have eventually become beasts themselves.

entries: The Flame of Elyia is the third and final synthetic Rune. Created by the ancient Chysti to aid in the containment of the Nameless Nightmares, it instead caused a cataclysm on Amarra. A cataclysm that is still impacting Amarra to this day.
