spell.name: Shield of Shadows
entries: An orb of shimmering magical darkness surrounds the target providing them with three-quarters cover, a creature with darkvision cannot see into the orb, and neither nonmagical or magical light can illuminate it. The target inside can see and act normally. If the target moves, the shield travels with them and they do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

spell.name: Power Word Shield

time.condition: which you or an an ally you can see is hit by an attack or targeted by the {@spell magic missile} spell.

entries: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you or an ally you can see that is within 30 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, the target has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and takes no damage from magic missile.
This AC bonus does not stack with the shield spell or similar effects.

spell.name: Sairis' Superior Siphon
entries: You begin to siphon the ambient aether from the area around you. Each round, for one minute, you regenerate 5 hit points. If you receive psychic or force damage, your regeneration is halted until the end of your next turn.
This ability can be used to force a missing limb to grow as well as knit a limb that has been removed back to the stump.
If this spell is used in an area of wild magic, the user must roll a d6 when they regenerate. On a result of a 1 or a 2, the user takes 1d4 damage instead of regaining hit points.

spell.name: Aperture of Ordinus
entries: You conjure a portal linking an unoccupied space you can see within range to a precise location on the Ordial Plane. The portal is a circular opening, which you can make 5 to 20 feet in diameter. You can orient the portal in any direction you choose. The portal lasts for the duration.

The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is instantly transported to the other plane, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal.
Deities and other planar rulers cannot prevent portals created by this spell from opening in their presence or anywhere within their domains.

spell.name: Falorin's Find and Follow

time.unit: reaction, a traveling spell must have recently been used within your sight.

entries: Using aetheric energy, you tap into the traveling spell that was just cast to determine its end point.
Make an Intelligence (Arcana) check, the DC for determining the location is listed on the table below:

If you succeed, you learn which plane the destination is on and for the duration of this spell you can use another spell to travel to the exact destination. After this spell expires, you retain the knowledge of which plane was traveled to, but can no longer access its exact location.

spell.name: Sairis' Spatial Shattering
entries: You split the aether of a target that you can see into spatial distortions of their self. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. If the target fails, then their aether is split and they are duplicated 3 times. The duplicates appear within 5 feet of the target, and have the same AC as the target, but each duplicate has 1/4th of the hit points of the target, and the target's maximum hit points are reduced to 1/4th. Additionally, the target and all duplicates are stunned.

At the end of each of the target's turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends and the duplicates are returned to the target and their hit point maximum returns to normal.

However when the spell ends, the target loses any hit points lost by their duplicates. If any of their duplicates have been killed, then they must make a Constitution saving throw DC 15 + 5 for each missing duplicate or take an additional 10d6 force damage, taking half damage on a successful save.

spell.name: Sairis' Spell Shift
entries: This potent spell opens your senses to the aether, allowing you to perceive its very current as clearly as you might see the trees in a forest while standing in the heart of it. When a spell is cast, you can visually observe its effects on the aether. Thanks to this heightened understanding, you can use the counterspell action to do much more than merely counter another caster's spell. Sairis' spell shift grants you advantage on Arcana checks made to identify spells for counterspelling. Furthermore, instead of simply negating the effect of a spell you successfully counter, you can choose from among the following options as long as Sairis' spell shift lasts.

items: Aid: You can boost the effectiveness of an ally's spell by applying any one metamagic feat from the following list: Empowered Spell, Heightened Spell, Quickened Spell, Twinned Spell, or Extended Spell. To use this option, you must expend a spell slot (or sacrifice a prepared spell) whose spell level equals or exceeds that of the ally's spell with the desired metamagic applied.

Manipulate: You can seize control of the spell's range, area, or targets, as appropriate, and reshape these factors as you choose. Only one property of the spell, chosen from among those that the caster can normally designate, can be manipulated in this manner.
Backlash: You counter the spell as normal, but your opponent must succeed on a Fortitude save or be stunned for 1d6 rounds.

spell.name: Sairis' Spell Scathe
entries: All magical effects and magic items within a 40 foot radius, except for those that you carry or touch, are disjoined. That is, spells and spell-like effects are separated into their individual components (ending the effect as a dispel magic spell does), and each permanent magic item must make a successful Wisdom save or be turned into a normal item. An item in a creature's possession uses its own Wisdom save bonus or its possessor's Wisdom save bonus, whichever is higher.
You also have a 1% chance per caster level of destroying an antimagic field. If the antimagic field survives the disjunction, no items within it are disjoined.

Even artifacts are subject to disjunction, though there is only a 1% chance per caster level of actually affecting such powerful items. Additionally, if an artifact is destroyed, you must make a DC 25 Wisdom save or permanently lose all spellcasting abilities. (These abilities cannot be recovered by mortal magic, not even miracle or wish.)

Note: Destroying artifacts is a dangerous business, and it is 95% likely to attract the attention of some powerful being who has an interest in or connection with the device or similar dire consequences.

spell.name: Sairis' Saber of Shadows
entries: You cause a black blade of negative energy to appear and attack opponents at a distance, as directed by you. Instead of dealing damage, a sword of darkness bestows one level of exhaustion on each successful hit against a living creature, threatens a critical hit on a roll of 19-20, and bestows two levels of exhaustion on a critical hit.
If the sword strikes an undead creature, it grants that creature 5 temporary hit points that last for up to 1 hour.

spell.name: Sairis' Sanguine Scarification
entries: You shoot a black ray of necromantic energy from your outstretched hand, causing your foe to violently purge blood or other vital fluids through his skin. This horrifying spell expels the victim's blood through his or her skin. You must succeed on a ranged spell attack with the ray this spell creates to strike a target. If successful, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, the subject loses half its hit points and is stunned for 1 round. On a successful saving throw, the victim loses one quarter of its hit points is not stunned.

spell.name: Eldritch Blade
entries: A weapon you wield becomes wreathed in crackling energy. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your weapon's reach. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is under the effect of a curse. On a hit, the target suffers force damage equal to your weapon's damage dice roll.
At Higher Levels. At 5th level the target takes an additional 1d10 force damage. This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 11th level (2d10) and 17th level (3d10).

spell.name: Falorin's Final Flourish
entries: The archwizard Falorin devised a new technique which he began teaching to his powerful students in Gru Shana near New Haven. By snapping your fingers and uttering the phrase, 'Trouble me no more.' this spell will disperse the essence of an entity with 0 hit points into the universe, preventing their return on another plane.
This spell duplicates the ability of the Wish spell to prevent certain creatures from resurrecting.

spell.name: Mistgwynn's Ornithological Mastery
entries: You summon fey spirits that take the form of beasts and appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:
Each beast is also considered fey, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the creatures' statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 7th-level slot, three times as many with a 8th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

spell.name: God's Divide
entries: You create a wall of holy light on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 necrotic or radiant damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 necrotic or radiant damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th level.

spell.name: Smite from Above
entries: A vertical column of divine fire roars down from the heavens in a location you specify. Each creature in a 10-foot radius, 10-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d6 fire damage and 2d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If struck by the full damage, the target is blinded until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage or the radiant damage (your choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th level.

spell.name: Spirit Fire
entries: The ground beneath a target location begins to turn turmoil or holy, tormenting or reckoning all creatures in contact. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 necrotic or radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Immobilizing Edge
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, a shards of ice fall from the sky, stabbing into the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal additional cold damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals an extra 1d6 cold damage to the target on a hit, and the creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be restrained until the end of their next turn. The damage roll increases by 1d6 at 11th level (2d6) and 17th level (3d6).

spell.name: Shocking Pierce
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, a blade runed with lightning magic erupts from the ground, stabbing into the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal additional lightning damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals an extra 1d6 lightning damage to the target on a hit, and the creature must succeed an Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until the end of their next turn. The damage roll increases by 1d6 at 11th level (2d6) and 17th level (3d6).

spell.name: Rending Blow
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, an azure blade erupts from the ground, stabbing into the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal additional slashing damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals an extra 1d8 slashing damage to the target on a hit, and the creature must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. The damage roll increases by 1d6 at 11th level (2d8) and 17th level (3d8).

spell.name: Radiant Shockwave
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, searing light shines down on the target and all creatures within 5 feet. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal additional radiant damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier to all creatures within 5 feet of your target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals an extra 1d4 radiant damage to the target on a hit. The damage roll increases by 1d4 at 11th level (2d4) and 17th level (3d4).

spell.name: Savage Crunch
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, a crimson spike erupts from the ground, stabbing into the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal additional piercing damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals an extra 1d8 piercing damage to the target on a hit, and the creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw or gain a level of exhaustion. The damage roll increases by 1d6 at 11th level (2d8) and 17th level (3d8).

spell.name: Shadowblade
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, an abyssal sword issues forth from the ground, stabbing into the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At 5th level, the attack awards an extra 1d4 temporary hit points. The temporary hit points roll increases by 1d4 at 11th level (2d4) and 17th level (3d4).

spell.name: Aetherblade
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, a violet sword curves out from the underworld under the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal additional psychic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals an extra 1d4 psychic damage to the target on a hit, and the creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or be blinded until the end of your next turn. The damage roll increases by 1d4 at 11th level (2d4) and 17th level (3d4).

spell.name: Crush Armaments
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you and one weapon or armor they are carrying. On a hit, a vibrant sword surges up from under the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and must succeed a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the targeted weapon or armor takes 3d6 force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Earth Sabre
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against a target within 20 feet. On a hit, the earth erupts in a 20-foot cone starting from the target and facing away from you. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and the target and all creatures in the cone must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage. Additionally, the area of the cone is rendered difficult terrain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ringing Edge
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and it begins to ring loudly. All creatures within 20 feet of you must succeed a Constitution saving throw or suffer the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, as well as an additional 1d6 piercing damage, and become deafened until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Flamewind Dance
entries: You flourish your weapon and then vanish to strike with the rage of the inferno. You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against a target within 20 feet. On a successful hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, plus an additional 1d10 fire damage, the target is knocked prone, and you teleport to within 5 feet of the target. If the hit is not successful you remain in your current position.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Blade Flash
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and it begins to ring loudly. All creatures in a 20-foot cone must succeed a Constitution saving throw or suffer the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, as well as an additional 1d6 radiant damage, and become blinded until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wind Cut
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and slash with a blade of wind. All creatures in a 15-foot cone must succeed a Strength saving throw or suffer the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, as well as an additional 1d4 thunder damage, and are pushed back 5 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Astral Slice
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, you charge astral energy from your soul into your weapon and swing it all forward in a violent surge of power at the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and takes an additional 1d8 psychic damage. If you and the target are on the astral plane and the target possesses a silver cord, they must succeed a Charisma saving throw equal to 10 + 1/2 of the total damage dealt or return to their body. If you and the target are not on the Astral Plane, they must succeed a Charisma saving throw equal to 5 + 1/2 of the total damage dealt or be forced from their body and onto the Astral Plane for 1 minute. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn each round to return to the Material Plane.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blade of Judgement
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 30 feet of you. On a hit, a shards of ice fall from the sky, stabbing into the target and all creatures within 5 feet. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal an additional 2d6 cold damage. All creatures with 5 feet of your target take cold damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. The target and all creatures within 5 feet must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be restrained until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage to all targets increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Divine Spear
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, a blade runed with lightning magic erupts from the ground, stabbing into the target. The target and all creatures within 5 feet suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and an additional 1d8 lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Heavenstrike
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, an azure blade erupts from the ground, stabbing into the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal an additional 2d8 slashing damage and cannot benefit from healing until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Radiant Ruination
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, searing light shines down on the target and all creatures between you and the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal an additional 3d6 radiant damage to all creatures in a line between you and your target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cleansing Strike
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 30 feet of you. On a hit, a crimson spike erupts from the ground, stabbing into the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal an additional 3d4 piercing damage. If the target is under the effect of Heroism, Aid, or Bless, one of the effects are ended, your choice.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Siphon Strike
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 30 feet of you. On a hit, an abyssal sword issues forth from the ground, stabbing into the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you restore hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Moon Edge
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 30 feet of you. On a hit, a violet sword curves out from the underworld under the target. The target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and you deal an additional 1d12 psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wave of Ruin
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and slash with a blade of hellish energy. All creatures in a 15-foot cone must succeed a Constitution saving throw or suffer the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, as well as an additional 4d4 necrotic damage, and are stunned until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Reverse Slash
entries: You empower your weapon with raw anger and slash with vengeance. You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, as well as additional force damage equal to the difference between your current hit points and maximum hit points.

spell.name: Maelstrom Edge
entries: You summon a tornado of white wind upon your foes to tear them asunder, you bring your sword down and swing it to send this devastating wave of wind from yourself at the target. You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 20 feet of you. On a hit, the target and all creatures in a 20-foot square with an edge centered on you and another edge centered on the target suffer the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and must succeed a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creatures take 3d6 slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shatterheart Stab
entries: You empower your weapon and strike with blood magic at their internal organs. You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, and becomes internally wounded. An internally wounded target suffers 1d12 piercing damage at the start of their turn. The target may attempt a Constitution saving throw at the end of their turn each round to negate the effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shieldshatter Slash
entries: You empower your weapon and strike with fierce magics at magical barriers. You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal dice damage without modifiers, as well as an additional 2d10 force damage. If there are any magical barriers such as a wall of force or a prismatic wall between you and your target, a 5-foot radius circle is ripped through them and remains open until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d10 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aethera
entries: Arcane energy flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of pure energy. Each creature in a 10-foot, 20-foot, and 40-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 6d6 force damage in the 10-foot sphere, 4d6 force damage in the 20-foot sphere, and 2d6 force damage in the 40-foot sphere on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

default: (a) a {@item greatsword|phb}, (b) any {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb}, or (c) any two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) an unholy symbol or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Dark Knight
entries: A human woman in plate armor strides across the battlefield, striking down enemies and leaving a wake of death behind her. Before her mages hurl spells in an attempt to slow her advance, but see seems to move through them unimpeded. They fear her and know that soon she will be among them, for like death, it is inevitable.

An elf stands with his blade drawn, shadows envelop him and he melds into them, becoming a shadow himself. His opponents blades pass through his shadowy form until he's in their midst. He becomes solid again and grins before his blade strikes out at his foes.

A dwarven man moves across a bloody battlefield, reveling in the chaos. A bolt of poison streaks through the air and strikes the dwarf in the chest. He laughs and with a grunt expels a fine crimson mist before rushing to meet the foolhardy spellcaster.
These are Dark Knights, a complex tank that can take an immense amount of punishment.

entries.name: Creating a Dark Knight
entries: As you build Dark Knight, think about the darkness that resides within you: When and where did this darkness arise? Are you ruthless or regretful? Did you have a mentor that taught you this path, or did you find it within yourself?

You might be a soldier or a commoner on a quest for revenge. Perhaps you trained in a war academy, learning tactics and swordplay. Or you might have grown up in a militant cult, learning dark magics and insurgency.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Dark Knight quickly by following these suggestions. First, Constitution should be your highest ability score, followed by Intelligence, and then Strength. Secondly, choose the {@background acolyte} or {@background soldier} background.

default: (a) a {@item scythe|alteia}, (b) a {@item whip|phb}, or (c) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item gaming set} or (b) any {@filter musical instrument|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=musical instrument}
(a) a {@item diplomat's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item scholar's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Seer

entries: Once I knew only darkness and stillness...my life was without past or future...but a little word from the fingers of another fell into my hand that clutched at emptiness, and my heart leaped to the rapture of living.
entries.by: Nhell Elkere, the High Seer of Azeria

entries: A woman sits in an empty stone room, her friends in the middle of enjoying their latest in a string of lucky victories. Of course, it never was luck, not that they'd ever know that. She meditates, soundless, motionless, determined to learn of something she knows she had missed. Next time, no one dies. Maybe next time.

A child awakens with a fright after having a terrible nightmare of a flood that would destroy a whole forest. But it wasn't a nightmare, and he knows that. If only he could have woken up 5 minutes sooner, then it wouldn't already be raining. He has exactly 33 minutes, 52 seconds, and 98 milliseconds. And he knows it.

An elderly man sits atop the throne he stole. Lesser creatures would be so eager to spend the earnings, but he knows that a kingdom is worthless if it falls. He knows every threat that will envelope the place for the short time left he has, and knows how to fight back against it. Not himself of course, what does he look like, an amateur?

entries.name: Living in the Future
entries: Seers are people that dedicate their lives to pursuing a specific outlet for their magical prowess. That specific outlet is the control over fate that seeing the future can provide, though it typically comes at a grave cost of being incredibly frail, since the training and mental exercising that is required for this both takes up all your free time and allows for little in the way of staying in shape. Worse yet, practicing for so long can make it difficult or even impossible for some seers to live for the present, always instinctively making plans for the possibilities they think of even when the dangers seem to of passed. Hopefully you'll become powerful enough to fix that, but it's very well possible that you won't live that long. Seers are often the target of good and evil creatures alike trying to steal the edge that comes with this ability, and without being either secretive or very clever about using your powers, you could easily get in over your head.

entries.name: Creating a Seer
entries: When making a Seer, ask yourself what made them pursue this path over other, less tedious (It typically takes years for most seers to harness their craft, longer than most Wizards) options? What does having so little contact with others outside of your seeing do to you? Who or what granted you the power to even try? It's likely you'll want to have some of these answers tucked away, so you should get the motivation and consequences of trying to be a seer integrated as early as you can.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Seer quickly by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution, and then Dexterity. Secondly, choose the {@background hermit} or {@background sage} background.

default: (a) a {@item priest's pack|phb}, or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Priest
entries: Priests are devoted to the spiritual, and express their unwavering faith by serving the people. For millennia they have left behind the confines of their temples and the comfort of their shrines so they can support their allies in war-torn lands. In the midst of terrible conflict, no hero questions the value of the priestly orders. These masters of the healing arts keep their companions fighting far beyond their normal capacities with an array of restorative powers and blessings. The divine forces at the priest's command can also be turned against foes, smiting them with holy fury. As light cannot exist without darkness, and darkness without light, some priests tap into the shadow current to better understand their own abilities, as well as the abilities of those who threaten them.

entries.name: The Divine
entries: It is faith in ourselves that separates us from others, and with our powers, we will cause great change in every realm. The weak will come to lean on you. The lepers will call you Lord. And the ignorant will look to you for guidance. Priest's harness the power of the divine in hope to restore their world back to true order.

entries.name: Holy Worshippers
entries: Priest's are devoted followers to their chosen god or diety, spending the majority of their life fulfilling their duty to their diety. Well adversed in the realm of magic and medicine, the priest channels ancestral magic to amplify their already strong magical power.

entries.name: Creating a Priest
entries: As you are creating your priest, keep in mind which god or diety you follow. Is it a god feeding you objectives to complete in order to serve them? Did you humbly select your god to worship or did some form of power or diety come to you either in seek of help or in desperation to control you. Are you going to heal and protect your allies from the back line or cast spells to torment your enemies minds.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a priest quickly by following thse suggestions. First, Intellegence should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution or Dexterity. Second choose the {@background sage} or {@background acolyte} background.

classFeature.name: Dark Arts
entries: You channel dark energy into your attacks at the expense of your vitality. When you make the attack action on your turn, you can spend a Hit Dice to weave Dark Arts into your attacks to achieve one of the following effects:

items: The Blackest Night. You gain temporary hit points equal to 1d12 plus your Intelligence modifier.
Abyssal Slash. If your attack hits, it deals damage as though it were a critical hit. However, you take half of the total damage dealt by the attack.

entries: When you gain the Extra Attack feature, different Dark Arts can be used to augment each attack. However, you cannot use multiple Dark Arts to augment a single attack.
Additionally, you must declare that you are using Dark Arts and state which Dark Art you wish to use before you make your roll to hit the target.

classFeature.name: Sanguine Strike
entries: You strike quickly with dark magic, siphoning the life essence of an enemy. As a bonus action you make a melee attack with your weapon. If the attack hits, you regain a number of hit points equal to half of the damage dealt by the attack.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to half of your Dark Knight level per long rest.

classFeature.name: Flood of Darkness
entries: At 2nd level you have gained the ability to feed off of the darkness to heal yourself. You can spend 10 minutes meditating in an area of dim light or darkness to regain half of your maximum hit points.
You can use this ability once per long rest.

classFeature.name: Dark Arts (Crushing Blow)
entries: At 2nd level, your mastery of the Dark Arts grows. You may use your Dark Arts feature to augment attacks with the following ability:
Crushing Blow. If your attack hits, your attack deals an additional 1d8 necrotic damage.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Your dabbling in dark forces allows you some command over the arcane. This dark energy, fuels your spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the {@filter Dark Knight spell list|spells|class=Dark Knight} for your spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Dark Knight spell list.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Dark Knight table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter Dark Knight spells|spells|class=Dark Knight} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the Dark Knight spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Dark Knight table shows when you learn more Dark Knight spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Dark Knight spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Dark Knight spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Dark Knight spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to manipulate dark energy without losing your mind. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Dark Knight spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item arcane focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your Dark Knight spells.

classFeature.name: Dark Order
entries: At 3rd level, you delve into the advanced techniques of a Dark Order that defines the darkness within you. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Dark Arts (Infernal Strike)
entries: At 5th level, your mastery of the Dark Arts grows. you gain the following Dark Arts option:
Infernal Strike. If your attack hits, you regain a spent spell slot of first level.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th Level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Dark Order feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your Dark Order.

classFeature.name: Quietus
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain the ability to harden your mind against forces that try to affect it. As a reaction, you gain a bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws equal to your Constitution modifier. Once you have used this ability it cannot be used again until you finish a short rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Empowered Dark Arts
entries: Starting at 9th level, your Dark Arts can be empowered at an even greater cost. You can spend an additional Hit Dice (two total Hit Dice) to empower your Dark Arts.

items: The Blackest Night, Empowered. You gain temporary hit points equal to 2d12 plus your Intelligence modifier.

Abyssal Slash, Empowered. If your attack hits, it deals damage as though it were a critical hit. The attack also deals an additional 1d12 necrotic damage (this damage is not doubled by the critical hit). However, you take half of the total damage dealt by the attack.
Crushing Blow, Empowered. If your attack hits, it deals an additional 2d8 necrotic damage.
Infernal Strike, Empowered. If your attack hits, you regain a spent spell slot of second level.

entries: For information about the empowerment of Dark Arts options granted by your Order selection, refer to the Dark Arts entry for your Order.

classFeature.name: Dark Order feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature from your Dark Order.

classFeature.name: Shadow Shield
entries: At 11th level the darkness itself becomes your armor. You gain a +3 bonus to your AC when you are in dim light or darkness.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Walking Dead
entries: Starting at 13th level, unholy magics can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 Hit Points and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead.
Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a short or Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.

classFeature.name: Dark Order feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your Dark Order.

classFeature.name: Dark Cunning
entries: At 15th level, when you roll for Initiative and have no Hit Dice remaining, you regain a number of Hit Dice equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Dark Arts (Unleash)
entries: At 17th level, your mastery of the Dark Arts grows. You gain the following Dark Arts option:

items: Unleash. Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or take 1d6 necrotic damage.
Unleash, Empowered. Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw DC 10 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or take 2d6 necrotic damage.

classFeature.name: Vehemence
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can use the shadows you normally defend yourself with to augment your attacks. The first time you attack on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of your Shadow Shield's bonus to your attack and damage rolls, instead of using the bonus to your AC that turn.
For example, you could reduce the bonus to your AC by 1 and increase your attack and damage rolls to +1. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Souleater
entries: At 20th level, you can unleash a devastating wave of negative energy in a 15 foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a Constitution saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or take 6d12 damage, taking half as much on a success.
Add the damage done to each target together, you take that amount of damage or an amount of damage equal to your maximum hit points minus 1, whichever is lower.
The damage done to you ignores temporary hit points, both in the damage calculations and when damage is done.
Once you have used this ability it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a magically empowered seer, you can use your uncanny foresight to predict what mistakes you could make trying to cast spells, and avoid them, allowing you to cast such spells. All Seer Class spells are considered arcane for seers, including those that normally are with classes that use divine or natural magic. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the {@filter Seer spell list|spells|class=Seer} for your spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know 2 cantrips from the seer spell list. You learn additional seer cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Seer table.

entries.name: Spellbook
entries: At 1st level, you have a spellbook containing six 1st-level {@filter seer spells|spells|level=1|class=Seer} of your choice. Your spellbook is the repository of the seer spells you know, except your cantrips, which are fixed in your mind.

entries.name: Preparing And Casting Spells
entries: The Seer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level or higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a spell slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest. You prepare the list of seer spells that are available for you to cast. To do so, choose a number of seer spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence modifier + your seer level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you are a 3rd-level seer, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination, chosen from your spellbook. If you prepare the 1st-level spell magic missile, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level spell slot. Casting a spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells. You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of seer spells requires time spent studying your spellbook and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your seer spells, since you learn your spells through intense mental training and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a seer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a seer spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell in your spellbook. You don't need to have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item arcane focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your seer spells.

entries.name: Learning Spells of 1st level And Higher
entries: Each time you gain a seer level, you can add two seers spell of your choice to your spellbook for free. The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the Seer Table. On your adventures, you might find other spells that you can add to your spellbook (see "Your Spellbook").

entries.name: Your Spellbook
entries: The spells that you add to your spellbook as you gain levels reflect the arcane research you conduct on your own, as well as intellectual breakthroughs you have had about the nature of the multiverse. You might find other spells during your adventures. You could discover a spell recorded on a scroll in a chest, for example, or in a dusty tome in an ancient library.
A spellbook doesn't contain cantrips.

entries.name: Copying a Spell into the Book
entries: When you find a seer spell of 1st level or higher, you can add it to your spellbook if it is of a spell level you can prepare and if you can spare the time to decipher and copy it.

Copying a spell into your spellbook involves reproducing the basic form of the spell, then deciphering the unique system of notation used by the seer or wizard who wrote it. You must practice the spell until you understand the sounds or gestures required, then transcribe it into your spellbook using your own notation.

For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the spell just like your other spells.

It costs 10 gold and 30 minutes per level of the spell to copy a divination spell into your spellbook, rather than the normal time and cost requirements. This feature does not stack with the Wizard's Divination Savant feature.

entries.name: Copying from a Spell Scroll
entries: A seer spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When you copy a spell from a spell scroll, you must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

entries.name: Multiclassing with Spellbooks
entries: For the purposes of multiclassing, separate sections, parted by 10 blank pages, can be used to have a single spellbook with wizard and seer spells on it. Copying spells from a Wizard's spellbook as a Seer spell is possible, and so is copying Seer spells into a Wizard spellbook, but only if the spell is on both spell lists. If you have a Seer spell in your spellbook that is also on the Wizard spell list and you have Wizard levels, you can cast the spell as a Wizard spell provided you have the spellslot to do so, and vice versa.

entries.name: Replacing the Book
entries: You can copy a spell from your own spellbook into another book—for example, if you want to make a backup copy of your spellbook. This is just like copying a new spell into your spellbook, but faster and easier, since you understand your own notation and already know how to cast the spell. You need spend only 1 hour and 10 gp for each level of the copied spell.

If you lose your spellbook, you can use the same procedure to transcribe the spells that you have prepared into a new spellbook. Filling out the remainder of your spellbook requires you to find new spells to do so, as normal. For this reason, many wizards keep backup spellbooks in a safe place.

entries.name: The Book's Appearance
entries: Your spellbook is a unique compilation of spells, with its own decorative flourishes and margin notes. It might be a plain, functional leather volume that you received as a gift from your master, a finely bound gilt-edged tome you found in an ancient library, or even a loose collection of notes scrounged together after you lost your previous spellbook in a mishap.

classFeature.name: Seer Archetype
entries: Choose one Seer Archetype from the list of avaiable archetypes. Each archetype is detailed in their own feature. Your choice grants you features at 1st, and again at 6th, 14th, and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Threads of Fate
entries: At 2nd level, you use your slight but growing precognition to amplify your quickest moments of opportunity.
You have two reactions each round, and can cast a cantrip as your opportunity attack in place of weapon attacks if you choose.

You can only use one reaction on any given event that allows you to use a reaction, such as only being able to make a single opportunity attack when a creature leaves your range. If the same type of trigger occurs twice however, you may use more than one reaction on the event it allows you to do (Such as a creature leaving your range twice in one turn, which is typically what allows you to attempt opportunity attacks).
You can only cast any particular spell as a reaction once between turns, meaning spells like shield do not have their effects stack.

classFeature.name: The Foretelling
entries: Starting at 3rd level, glimpses of the future begin to press in on your awareness.

When you finish a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 5th level, you've learned to make up for your lack of speed with prediction and momentum.
You can make two weapon attacks when you use the attack action on your turn. You can replace one of your weapon attacks with a cantrip that requires an attack roll.

classFeature.name: Seer Archetype feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your Seer Archetype.

classFeature.name: A Series of Unfortunate Events
entries: At 7th level, your understanding of different possibilities allows you to literally make the best out of a bad situation.

Whenever you have disadvantage on an Attack Roll, Ability Check, or Saving Throw but roll a 20 on one of the dice, you can keep the 20 as your roll. In the case of attacks, one roll of 20 is a normal hit while both is a critical, which does the maximum damage possible when it occurs this way.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Critical Moment
entries: At 9th level, you can capitalize on your successes more, because you see them coming a mile away.

items: Your attacks are critical hits on a roll of 19 or 20, and if you get a critical hit you may make an additional single weapon attack as a bonus action.
If your opportunity attack is a critical hit, you may use another reaction to make another opportunity attack with a single weapon attack instead.

classFeature.name: Greater Foretelling
entries: Starting at 10th level, strong visions of the future begin to press in on your awareness constantly.

When you finish a long rest, roll three d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

classFeature.name: Greater Threads of Fate
entries: At 11th level, you use your slight but growing precognition to amplify your quickest moments of opportunity.
You have three reactions each round, and can cast a cantrip as your opportunity attack in place of weapon attacks if you choose.

You can only use one reaction on any given event that allows you to use a reaction, such as only being able to make a single opportunity attack when a creature leaves your range. If the same type of trigger occurs twice however, you may use more than one reaction on the event it allows you to do (Such as a creature leaving your range twice in one turn, which is typically what allows you to attempt opportunity attacks).
You can only cast any particular spell as a reaction once between turns, meaning spells like shield do not have their effects stack.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Improved Extra Attack
entries: At 13th level, you can make three weapon attacks when you use the attack action on your turn, but can still only replace one of your weapon attacks with a cantrip that requires an attack roll.

classFeature.name: Seer Archetype feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your Seer Archetype.

classFeature.name: Most Critical Moment
entries: At 15th level, you can capitalize on your opponent's failures as well, as they'll never see it coming.
Your attacks are critical hits on a roll of 18, 19, or 20

When an opponent misses you with an attack, you can make an opportunity attack as a reaction. If you hit this opportunity attack, the target of it can't target you for any attacks or spells until the end of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Master of Foretelling
entries: Starting at 17th level, intense visions of the future begin to constantly assault your consciousness.

When you finish a long rest, roll four d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

Additionally, you gain the spell Foresight, this spell does not count against your number of spells learned per level as a Seer and does not need to be recorded in your spellbook to be prepared or cast.

classFeature.name: Seer Archetype feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature from your Seer Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Master of Fate
entries: At 20th level, everything you do is so well calculated that you can basically guarantee success or failure. When you roll your foretelling dice, you may discard the lowest result and change it to a 1 or a 20.

classFeature.name: Purify
entries: Adept in the knowledge of a creature's energy, twice per day during a short rest you are able to cleanse a willing creature's body. Doing so, removes all disease or poison conditions currently effecting them.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a magically empowered Priest, you can use your uncanny foresight to predict what mistakes you could make trying to cast spells, and avoid them, allowing you to cast such spells. All Priest Class spells are considered arcane for Priests, including those that normally are with classes that use divine or natural magic. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the {@filter Priest spell list|spells|class=Priest} for your spells.

entries: At 1st level, you know 2 cantrips from the Priest spell list. You learn additional Priest cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Priest table.

To do so, choose a number of Priest spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence modifier + your Priest level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you are a 3rd-level Priest, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination, chosen from your spellbook. If you prepare the 1st-level spell magic missile, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level spell slot. Casting a spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells. You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of Priest spells requires time spent studying your spellbook and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Priest spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries: You can cast a Priest spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell in your spellbook. You don't need to have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item arcane focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your Priest spells.

entries.name: Learning Spells of 1st level And Higher
entries: Each time you gain a Priest level, you can add two Priests spell of your choice to your spellbook for free. The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the Priest Table. On your adventures, you might find other spells that you can add to your spellbook (see "Your Spellbook").

You might find other spells during your adventures. You could discover a spell recorded on a scroll in a chest, for example, or in a dusty tome in an ancient library.
A spellbook doesn't contain cantrips.
