entries.name: Copying from a Spell Scroll
entries: A Priest spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When you copy a spell from a spell scroll, you must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

entries.name: Multiclassing with Spellbooks
entries: For the purposes of multiclassing, separate sections, parted by 10 blank pages, can be used to have a single spellbook with wizard and Priest spells on it. Copying spells from a Wizard's spellbook as a Priest spell is possible, and so is copying Priest spells into a Wizard spellbook, but only if the spell is on both spell lists. If you have a Priest spell in your spellbook that is also on the Wizard spell list and you have Wizard levels, you can cast the spell as a Wizard spell provided you have the spellslot to do so, and vice versa.

entries.name: Replacing the Book
entries: You can copy a spell from your own spellbook into another book—for example, if you want to make a backup copy of your spellbook. This is just like copying a new spell into your spellbook, but faster and easier, since you understand your own notation and already know how to cast the spell. You need spend only 1 hour and 10 gp for each level of the copied spell.

If you lose your spellbook, you can use the same procedure to transcribe the spells that you have prepared into a new spellbook. Filling out the remainder of your spellbook requires you to find new spells to do so, as normal. For this reason, many wizards keep backup spellbooks in a safe place.

entries.name: The Book's Appearance
entries: Your spellbook is a unique compilation of spells, with its own decorative flourishes and margin notes. It might be a plain, functional leather volume that you received as a gift from your master, a finely bound gilt-edged tome you found in an ancient library, or even a loose collection of notes scrounged together after you lost your previous spellbook in a mishap.

classFeature.name: Divine Discipline
entries: At first level. chose a pathway paved by your diety in order to protect others from the hands of pure evil. Choose a Divine Discipline in order to self-righteously restore your realm to order. Each discipline is detailed at the end of the class description and each one provides examples of gods associated with it. Your choice grants your discipline spells and other features when you choose it at 2nd level. It also grants you features at 2nd level and additional benefits at 6th, 14th and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Eternal Servitude
entries: At second level, your diety or god blesses you, allowing you to cast a touch spell without touching the target.
When using this ability, the range of the spell becomes 30 feet and requires that you be able to see the target. Additionally, a spell used this way can only have a single target.
You can use this ability a number of times per long rest equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can 't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Power Infusion
entries: Starting at 5th level, as an action you are able to channel the power of your diety to bless a creature within 60 feet, granting them advantage on attack rolls and additional damage on all attacks and spells equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum one) until the start of your next turn. You regain use of this feature after you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Divine Discipline feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your Divine Discipline.

classFeature.name: Improved Eternal Servitude
entries: Your Eternal Servitude feature grants an additional 5 feet of range up to a maximum range of 35 feet.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8 th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can 't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Clarity of Will
entries: Starting at 10th level, you are able to create divine barriers to protect allies. As a reaction, you are able to create a magical barrier around a creature within 30 feet, until the start of their next turn they have a bonus to their AC equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12 th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can 't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Superior Eternal Servitude
entries: Your Eternal Servitude feature grants an additional 5 feet of range up to a maximum of 40 feet.

classFeature.name: Divine Discipline feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your Divine Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16 th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can 't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sacred Scream
entries: Starting at 17th level, you can use your action to scream with intense psychic force. Any creature within 10 feet of you must succeed an Intelligence saving throw DC 10 plus your Intelligence modifier plus your proficiency modifier or become frightened until the end of your next turn. If the creature is a humanoid, it has disadvantage on the saving throw.

classFeature.name: Divine Discipline feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature from your Divine Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19 th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can 't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Deliverance
entries: When you reach 20th level, you ascend to a higher form of devotion, unlocking a small fragment of your diety's ancestral power. As a reaction, when an ally within 30 feet of you take damage, knocking them unconcious. Restore them back to life with HP equal to half their hit die. This ancestral magic can be used once day.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Shadows
entries: Originally started as an order of spy-knights, the Order of Shadows now lurks in the dark places of the world. Shadow Knights as they prefer to be called can be found filling roles as assassins, mercenaries, and as always, spies.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Arts (Shadows)
entries: When you choose this Order at 3rd level, you gain the following two Dark Arts options:

items: Shadow Strike. You dissappear into the shadows and reappear up to 10 feet away.
Sinister Slash. You gain advantage on your next attack but you cannot imbue it with a Dark Art.

entries: When you achieve 9th level, you can empower these Dark Arts options as follows:

items: Shadow Strike, Empowered. You dissappear into the shadows and reappear up to 20 feet away.
Sinister Slash, Empowered. You gain advantage on your next attack.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowsight
entries: At 6th level, you have gained the ability to see in complete darkness. You gain Superior Darkvision with a 60 foot radius, you retain your ability to distinguish color in total darkness and can see through magical darkness as though it was dim light.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Form
entries: When you reach 10th level, you can transform yourself into shadow-stuff. For 1 minute, you can fit through openings of 1 square inch or larger, you have a +10 bonus on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.
However, while in shadow form, you can't speak or interact with anything in a physical manner.

If you occupy a space that's too tight for you when the effect ends, you are displaced to the nearest space where you'll fit; you take 1d6 bludgeoning damage for each 5 feet you were displaced to reach that spot.
Once you have used this ability, you cannot do so again until you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Manipulate Darkness
entries: When you reach 14th level, you can manipulate the shadows that envelop you. When you are in conditions of dim light or darkness, as a reaction, you can transfer the benefits of your Shadow Shield to a friendly creature that you can see within 20 feet of you until the start of your next turn.
When you achieve 18th level, you may utilize the Vehemence ability with this feature.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, regaining uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Death
entries: In the deepest corners of the ancient crypts, the Order of Death conducts their business. Their members are said to control hordes of undead and be impossible to permanently kill, though with such a sinister name, it is no surprise that legends surround this secretice order.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Arts (Death)
entries: When you choose this Order at 3rd level, you gain the following two Dark Arts options:

items: Desecration. You create a 10 ft radius circle of unholy ground beneath your feet until the start of your next turn. The area is considered difficult terrain for anyone aside from you, and any creature that enters the area or starts their turn in the area must make a Constitution saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or take 1d4 damage.
Bone Shield. The next time that you take damage from an attack, spell, or ability, the damage is reduced by 5. This effect ends at the start of your next turn.

entries: When you achieve 9th level, you can empower these Dark Arts options as follows:

items: Desecration, Empowered. You create a 15 ft radius circle of unholy ground beneath your feet until the start of your next turn. The area is considered difficult terrain for anyone aside from you, and any creature that enters the area or starts their turn in the area must make a Constitution saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or take 2d4 damage.
Bone Shield, Empowered. The next time that you take damage from an attack, spell, or ability, the damage is reduced by 10. This effect ends at the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unmend
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can steal life magic from those attempting to heal. When a creature within 60 feet of you casts a spell that restores hit points to a single target, you can use your reaction to halve the healing that their target receives, regaining hit points equal to the amount of healing prevented.
Once you have used this ability you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Wraith Walk
entries: At 10th level, you prove that little can stop the pursuit of death. You are no longer affected by difficult terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Stalwart Soul
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to shrug off effects that would prevent you from acting. If you are stunned, restrained, or paralyzed by a magical effect that requires an ongoing saving throw that is not a part of an area effect, at the beginning of your turn you can use your reaction to end the effect on yourself.
Once you have used this ability you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Frost
entries: Started in the frozen north, the Order of Frost uses icy magic to enhance their attacks. The Frost Knights are a formidable force on the battlefiend, often working as guards or soldiers.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Arts (Frost)
entries: When you choose this Order at 3rd level, you gain the following two Dark Arts options:

items: Frost Strike. Your target must succeed a Constitution saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

Avalanche. Ice shards explode from your weapon, the target of your attack and every creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or take 1d4 cold damage.

entries: When you achieve 9th level, you can empower these Dark Arts options as follows:

items: Frost Strike, Empowered. Your target must succeed a Constitution saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or be stunned for 1 minute. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn.

Avalanche, Empowered. Ice shards explode from your weapon, the target of your attack and every creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or take 2d4 cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Path of Frost
entries: At 6th level, ice forms beneath your feet. You can move across and stand on water as though it were solid ground.

subclassFeature.name: Freezing Weapons
entries: When you reach 10th level, you can imbue your weapons with ice. For 1 minute, your weapons deal an additional 1d4 cold damage and are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming damage reduction.
Once you have used this ability you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hailstorm
entries: At 14th level, you can call down icy shards to pierce your foes. As an action, you point to a point that you can see within 60 feet of you. Icy shards erupt from that point in a 20-foot radius sphere. Each creature within the sphere must succeed a Dexterity saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Intelligence modifier or take 4d8 cold damage, taking half as much on a success.
Once you have used this ability it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Blood
entries: The Order of Blood is fascinated with the sacred juices of mortal beings, seeking to understand the mysteries of these holy fluids. While most are off-put by their strange and messy preferences, most agree that they can be quite formidable.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Arts (Blood)
entries: When you choose this Order at 3rd level, you gain the following two Dark Arts options:

items: Heartseeker. If your attack hits, the target suffers a heart palpitation. A palpitated target takes 1d4 damage at the start of their turn for 3 rounds. A target cannot suffer from multiple palpitations from this ability at once.
Blood Drinker. If your attack hits, you regain 1d4 hit points at the start of your turn for 3 rounds. You can only drink blood from one target at a time.

entries: When you achieve 9th level, you can empower these Dark Arts options as follows:

items: Heartseeker, Empowered. If your attack hits, the target suffers a heart palpitation. A palpitated target takes 2d4 damage at the start of their turn for 3 rounds. A target cannot suffer from multiple palpitations from this ability at once.
Blood Drinker, Empowered. If your attack hits, you regain 2d4 hit points at the start of your turn for 3 rounds. You can only drink blood from one target at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Transfer Toxins
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain the ability to move toxins from one creature to another. If you or a target you are touching is poisoned or intoxicated, you can transfer the condition to yourself or another creature that you are also touching.

If the creature that you have designated as the recipient of the condition is unwilling, then they must make a Constitution saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or suffer the condition. If the creature succeeds, then you receive the condition instead.
Once you use this ability you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Purge
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can violently purge your blood of toxins. You can remove the poisoned or intoxicated effects from yourself, however for each effect removed you take 1d6 damage. All creatures within 5 feet of you must succeed a Dextrity saving throw DC 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or suffer 1d4 necrotic damage per effect removed.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Blood
entries: Starting at 14th level, your blood is teeming with dark energy. Each time you finish a long rest you may choose to gain resistance to either radiant or necrotic damage, your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Blades
entries: Originally trained by the church to fight dark forces with darkness, the Order of Blades has fast risen through the ranks to occupy a role as temple guards and other high ranking positions. Dark Knights trained by the Order of Blades utilize some magics similar to those of the Holy Knights.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Arts (Blades)
entries: When you choose this Order at 3rd level, you gain the following two Dark Arts options:

items: Steady Sword. You point your blade at a spot you can see within 20 feet and a cluster of icy crystals bursts from that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency modifier plus your Intelligence modifier. A creature takes 1d6 cold damage on a failed save and is restrained until the end of your next turn, or takes half as much damage on a successful one and is not restrained.

Crush Punch. You point your blade at a target you can see within 40 feet and a spike erupts from the ground beneath them. The target must make a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency modifier plus your Intelligence modifier. A creature takes 1d8 piercing damage on a failed save and is knocked prone, or takes half as much damage on a successful one and is not knocked prone.

entries: When you achieve 9th level, you can empower these Dark Arts options as follows:

items: Steady Sword, Empowered. You point your blade at a spot you can see within 20 feet and a cluster of icy crystals bursts from that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency modifier plus your Intelligence modifier. A creature takes 2d6 cold damage on a failed save and is restrained until the end of your next turn, or takes half as much damage on a successful one and is not restrained.

Crush Punch, Empowered. You point your blade at a target you can see within 40 feet and a spike erupts from the ground beneath them. The target must make a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency modifier plus your Intelligence modifier. A creature takes 2d8 piercing damage on a failed save and is knocked prone, or takes half as much damage on a successful one and is not knocked prone.

subclassFeature.name: Plunge
entries: At 6th level you can move quickly into battle. As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature that you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Parry
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Carve and Spit
entries: Beginning at 14th Level, you can attack three times, instead of twice, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. However, your third attack cannot be modified by Dark Arts.

subclassFeature.name: Awakened
entries: You are a contradiction, you are blind, yet see. Only, your sight is an extrasensory perception that allows you to see the future with incredible accuracy. Sometimes these visions are those of victory and glory, but more often they are terrible warnings of devastating events to come.
You not only see the future, but as you grow more and more powerful you gain the ability to alter the very fabric of fate itself. This power comes at the cost of sight, and for others, their sanity.

subclassFeature.name: The Third Eye
entries: You are blind, either as an accident, birth defect or an intentional choice to pursue this power. As such, you always suffer the Blind Status Aliment, and cannot be cured of it through normal means, including normal spells.

Spells work as effectively as if you could see (except those requiring an attack roll are still made at disadvantage from your blindness, foresight still gives you advantage instead of merely negating your disadvantage on attacks, for example), but those that need you to see specific targets of the spell require you to know where those targets are in some way (such as hearing them or feeling them), or accurately guessing where they are in relation to you (if you guess and miss, the spell is wasted).

Spells that give you some measure of temporary vision lock off your foresight, causing you to be unable to use any of your seer class features other than those unrelated to seeing (like spellcasting, proficiencies, etc) until you are blind once again; but of that same vein, since this blindness is now part of who you are nothing can restore your vision if you are unwilling to allow it, short of a deity. If an overdeity restores your vision, whether temporarily or permanently, you keep your seer class features, depending on the disposition of the deity.
You can still read and write in your spellbook in spite of your blindness, along with any Seer Spellbook or Spell Scroll (if the scroll has a Seer spell on it).

subclassFeature.name: Sense Fate
entries: You have learned to see possible futures while awake, as a result of being blind.

You are immune to the Suprised condition, always roll Initiative before the first attack occurs, and you can use your reaction at the start of Initiative to warn everyone that can hear you of the threat, preventing them from being Suprised.
Additionally, you may provide one willing target with advantage on their Initiative roll when warning them this way.

subclassFeature.name: Twist Fate
entries: At 6th level, your grasp on the weave of fate has strengthened to the point that you can alter it slightly. Once per short rest, you may use one of your foretelling rolls to instead provide advantage or disadvantage on any roll.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes Wide Shut
entries: At 14th level, you are so good at seeing the future that you can glimpse a mere moment ahead, effectively allowing you to see very near to the present.

You can navigate on your own as if you could see, regardless of the amount of light present, and no longer have disadvantage on skill checks and saving throws as a result of being blind, nor do enemies have advantage on their attacks because of you being blind.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in Intelligence Saving Throws if you do not have it already.

subclassFeature.name: The Blind Prophet
entries: At 18th level, you have truly mastered the art of foretelling. When you finish a long rest, roll five d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.
Additionally, you gain an additional use of Twist Fate per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dreamer
entries: You are a strange sort, sleeping to gain knowledge about the future as well as the events happening around you. When you dream, you are transported to a vivid world of your own creation, wondrous but also dangerous; it can cause your grasp on the waking world to slip away.
You have the ability to dream of the future, but as you grow more powerful you gain the ability to alter your dreamscape; walk in other places, and even transport others into your dreamscape.

subclassFeature.name: Sleepytime Junction
entries: You are more susceptible to being really tired. If caught in an effect that can make you fall asleep, you do automatically, regardless of if you could resist against or be immune to the effect. This includes the sleep spell and similar effects, regardless of if the spell rolls high enough to knock you unconscious (but still wastes the hit points if you are caught in it).

In addition, you have disadvantage on saving throws that cause Exhaustion on a failure. Your constant sleepiness makes you go with the flow more, allowing you to add your Charisma modifier to attack and damage rolls made with Heavy weapons instead of your Strength modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Memetic Dreamscape
entries: Your mind no longer simply dreams, instead when you sleep you are transported to a vivid and shifting dreamscape of your own design. While inside this dreamscape, you have perfect recall as you are able to peruse your memories as though they were books on a shelf or boxes of papers filed away.
Additionally, any Insight or Investigation checks made within the dreamscape to discern knowledge from your memories is made with advantage and the effects and range of the scrying spell are doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Prophetic Dreams
entries: At 6th level, your dreams become more clear and focused, allowing you to see upcoming events through a window in the dreamscape.
Once per short rest you may allow yourself or a friendly target that you can see the ability to reroll a failed Saving Throw. The new result must be kept.

subclassFeature.name: Dreamwalker
entries: At 14th level you have gained the ability to step from your own dreamscape into other worlds, while you are within your dreamscape you may cast astral projection without needing material components or expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can't take other creatures with you.
In addition, you have advantage on Charisma Saving throws. This effect extends outside of your dreamscape.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Dreams
entries: At 18th level you have become the master of your dreamscape such that you can go there physically.

Once per long rest you can transport yourself and up to 10 willing creatures within 30 feet of you into your dreamscape for one hour. Every creature targeted by this ability falls under the effects of the sleep spell and regains consciousness within your dreamscape. After one hour has passed (in the waking world, keep in mind that time may differ wildly within the dreamscape), all the targets awaken.
While using this ability, you may also take creatures with you via your Dreamwalker feature, however the effect still ends at the one hour mark.

subclassFeature.name: Cartomancy
entries: Some event in your past, whether it be through blood or study or making a pact with an otherworldly being, has left the indelible mark of the afterlife upon you. Along with a magical deck of cards that you have come into possession of, you are able to create powerful magical effects and see events of the future, so long as you draw the right card.
You have the ability to divine the future through a mix of card reading and spirit sessions, but as you grow more powerful you gain the ability to alter yours and others fates.

subclassFeature.name: Friends on the Other Side
entries: You are hounded by restless spirits that bring you visions through card reading. Though not all of them are malevolent, many of them cause minor mishaps and other strange occurrences. As a result, your magic becomes wildly unpredictable, even to you. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, roll a d20. On a 1, your magic acts in an unexpected way. The spell's effect applies as normal, but a random effect is applied depending on the result. Consult the following chart to determine the outcome:

entries.caption: Friends on the Other Side
rows: The Fool. You immediatly are subject to the effects of the spell Otto's Irresistible Dance as if you had cast it on yourself. When affected by the spell in this way, it does not take your concentration and bypasses any immunity to the {@condition charmed} condition you may have.
The Magician. You regain up a number of levels worth of expended spell slots equal to your proficiency bonus.

The High Priestess. You shift to a random plane of the afterlife (selected by your DM) until the end of your next turn, at which point you return unharmed to the space you previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
The Empress. For 1d4 minutes, you can stablize any creature within 30 feet of you when their health is reduced to 0 hit points by using your reaction.
The Emperor. One enemy and one allied creature of your choice, which may include yourself, take 4d10 necrotic damage.

The Hierophant. For the next minute, your skin becomes monochromatic, utterly devoid of all color and you can sense any undead creatures within 60 feet, regardless of their cover or protective enchantments.

The Lovers. Spirits surge to protect creatures within 10 feet of you, including yourself, granting an amount of temporary hit points equal to your seer level plus your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points do not affect undead or constructs.
The Chariot. You are enveloped in a thick mist, reappearing in an unoccupied space of the DM's choice within 30 feet of your original position.

Justice. Radiant energy builds up around you and explodes outward. You and every creature within 30 feet of you make a constitution saving throw or take radiant damage equal to five times your level, divided among the affected creatures. Creatures are {@condition blinded} and take full damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success and are not {@condition blinded}.
The Hermit. You become invisible until the start of your next turn.
Wheel of Fortune. Your clothing becomes rotten and stringy. All equipped armor and clothing no longer benefit your armor class. Magical items are unaffected.
Strength. Until the end of your next turn, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and a creature of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of you gains advantage on attacks rolls.

The Hanged Man. Your body begins to lock up and freeze in place as one of the spirits attempts to possess you. After you have fully cast your spell, you are {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn.
Death. Alternative timelines and events in the immediate future flash before your eyes. You cannot be reduced to lower than 1 hit point for the next {@dice 1d4} turns.
Temperance. A wave of healing energy washes over creatures within 10 feet of you. They regain an amount of hit points equal to your intelligence modifier + your proficiency bonus.
The Devil. You gain the voice of an eldritch horror. For the next hour, you can only speak in deep speech. A {@spell remove curse} or {@spell greater restoration} spell can end this effect early.

The Tower. At the start of your next turn, a lightning bolt strikes, you and each creature within 5 feet of you make a dexterity saving throw or take lightning damage equal to your seer level plus your proficiency bonus.
The Star. A spiritual elk appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you. It uses the statistics of a {@creature Unicorn|MM} and fights alongside you for the next minute.
The Moon. You are surrounded by faint, ethereal whispers and chattering sounds for the next minute, giving you disadvantage on Charisma ability checks to influence others for 2d4 hours.
The Sun. You gain resistance to a damage type of your choice for the next 10 minutes.

Judgement. The spirits course through your magical energy, attempting to possess the targets of your spell. If the spell did not require a saving throw the creature must make a Charisma saving throw or become {@condition stunned} on a failed save until the end of your next turn. If the spell required a saving throw, this effect is in addition to the spells normal effects.
The World. You may grant a nearby creature, including yourself a d20 inspiration dice.

entries: In addition, whenever a foe attempts to use an effect to possess or dominate you and the effect allows a saving throw to negate, you may roll with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanted Deck
entries: You employ tools that aid you in channeling spirits, be they historical figures of legend, fictional archetypes or your ancestors. You use a special deck of cards created through blood, study or a pact with an otherworldly being as a spellcasting focus for your seer spells, such as a 52-card, teuila, tarot, or tarokka deck.

When you cast a seer spell as a ritual, you can use the spell's normal casting time, rather than adding 10 minutes to it. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Stacking the Deck
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you cast a seer spell that deals damage or restores hit points, roll a {@dice d6}, and you gain a bonus to one damage or healing roll of the spell equal to the number rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Dealer's Choice
entries: At 14th level, if you trigger a roll on the Friends on the Other Side table, you may instead use your Stacking the Deck die to influence the result by the number rolled on the die, increasing or decreasing your result by a number equal to or less than the result rolled instead of increasing your spell damage or healing.
Additionally, you can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Arcanum
entries: When you reach the 18th level, you may alter fate, drawing upon the court of one of the four minor arcana from your enchanted deck to aide you in combat. Roll a {@dice 1d4} and draw a king of minor arcana listed below based on the number rolled.

entries.name: 1 - King of Swords
entries: A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration in a space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet. The guardian occupies that space and is indistinct except for a gleaming greatsword and fiery crown that rests upon their head.

Any creature hostile to you that occupies the area when the guardian is summoned, starts it's turn or moves to a space within 10 feet of the guardian for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@dice 8d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The guardian vanishes after {@dice 2d4} rounds.

entries.name: 2 - King of Wands
entries: You cast the spell {@spell dominate monster} targeting two creatures of your choice as if you cast the spell at the 9th level. You concentrate on this ability as if it were one spell.

entries.name: 3 - King of Pentacles
entries: For 1 minute, you are surrounded by a pulsating, sparkling, glow. For the duration, if you are targeted by a spell of 6th level or lower that has a duration of Instantaneous, you may use your reaction to add your spellcasting ability modifier to your saving throw (if the spell requires one) or to your AC (if the spell requires an attack roll). As part of the same reaction, you may absorb that spell's energy.

Until the King of Pentacles has ended, you may then use your bonus action to either immediately cast the absorbed spell yourself at its lowest level, without spending a spell slot, or to transform the spell into a spell slot of a level equal to the spell's lowest level. For example, if you are caught in a {@spell fireball} cast with a 5th-level spell slot, you may choose to be able to cast the fireball as if with a 3rd-level slot or gain a 3rd-level slot to use.

You may absorb multiple spells during the duration of this effect. When the effect ends, the absorbed spells are lost, but you may keep any transformed spell slots. These slots last until you use them or you complete a long rest.

entries.name: 4 - King of Cups
entries: You call forth a torrent of healing waters in a 30-foot cone. Creatures you choose in the area regain {@dice 10d6} hit points. A creature targeted by this spell that has 0 hit points instead regains hit points equal to half their hit point maximum.

Undead in the area of the spell must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@dice 10d6} radiant damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. An undead creature killed by this spell cannot be regenerated or reanimated by any means short of a wish spell.
Once you have used this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 9th-level spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Astromancy
entries: Flavor Text Goes Here

subclassFeature.name: LevelOneFeature1
entries: You are level one feature one
These generally have a bad effect, as a curse for your prophetic visions

subclassFeature.name: LevelOneFeature2
entries: You are level one feature two
This is generally a boon related to your curse.

subclassFeature.name: LevelSixFeature
entries: At 6th level, you gain some dice effecting ability related to your theme; things like rerolling a save and keeping the new result or turning a swing to advantage

subclassFeature.name: Level14Feature
entries: When you reach 14th level, you gain a spell-like ability to lighten or counteract your curse
You also gain some personal defensive advantage

subclassFeature.name: Level18Feature
entries: At 18th level, you master your form of divination, you can do something on the verge of 9th level spell-like effects or bolster a previous feature to such heights.
If lesser, also add aditional resources

subclassFeature.name: Holy
entries: After spending much of their lives in temples studying ancient doctrine, preaching the tenets of their faith, and pledging their full devotion to the divine powers they follow, the most adept priests leave their houses of worship to serve on the battlefield, as shepherd to flock. There, they use their holy powers to bless allies and mend wounds. And while most stay behind the frontlines to aid their comrades, these holy champions are also capable of smiting foes and carrying out sacred justice. They're also morally opposed to the use of Shadow and Void magic - rather, they are exemplars of the incredible grace and power of the divine and the Light, and even death cannot fully stop their healing capabilities.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Discipline Spells
entries: Once you gain a discipline spell, you always have it prepared and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you have a discipline spell that doesn't appear on the priest spell list, the spell is nonetheless a priest spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Blessing
entries: At first level your healing spells are more effective. Whenever you use a spell to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hitpoints equal to the spell's level + your intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Proficient Healer
entries: Starting at second level, you have advantage on all medicine checks that relate to humanoids and two other monster types of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Salvation
entries: Starting at 6th level, your admiration towards companions is strengthened. Your movement speed is doubled when moving towards an injured ally with the intent of healing. Failure to heal wounded ally results in the loss of your action for that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Healing
entries: Starting at 14th level, the healing spells you cast on others heal you as well. When you cast a spell that restores hit points to a creature other than you, you regain hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).

subclassFeature.name: Beacon of Life
entries: Starting at 18th level, any number of creatures (up to your Intelligence modifier) within 30 feet of you gain the effect of the spell beacon of hope. A creature that is not on the same plane as you cannot benefit from this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Truth
entries: While some priests may choose the shadow and others the light. The Discipline of Truth is about walking between those paths and defending against them. While those following the shadow discipline focus on dealing damage or corrupting the minds of their foes and the priests of the holy discipline are adept healers that aid their allies, priests of the discipline of truth provide defenses and damage mitigation in addition to some damage and healing abilities. Priests of Truth also focus on the acquisition of knowledge and ancient texts so that they might be preserved and proliferated around the world. As for the gods, priests of the truth discipline are searching for meaning and purpose, often serving multiple gods.

subclassFeature.name: Truth Discipline Spells
entries: Once you gain a discipline spell, you always have it prepared and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you have a discipline spell that doesn't appear on the priest spell list, the spell is nonetheless a priest spell for you.

entries.caption: Truth Discipline Spells
rows: {@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell wall of force}

subclassFeature.name: Power Word Shield
entries: Your proficiency with the art of shielding is second to none. Starting at 1st level, you learn the power word shield spell. It is always prepared and does not count against your prepared spells per day.

subclassFeature.name: Truth Seeker
entries: Being adept in the skills of research you are able to discover the history of the people and places of the world as well as gain some insight into their opinions. Starting at 2nd level, you become proficient in Insight and History. If you are already proficient in either, your proficiency bonus is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Pain Suppression
entries: Starting at 6th level, your ability to mitigate pain allows you to suppress its effects. As a reaction action, you can grant yourself or one ally that you can see that is within 30 feet of you advantage on a Constitution or Death Saving Throw.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Schism
entries: Starting at 14th level, your mastery over the truth allows you to weave energies seemlessly. You can use this ability in the following ways:

items: You can use a bonus action when casting a spell that does damage. Yourself or one target that you can see within 20 feet of you recieves 1d4 plus your Intelligence modifier in hit points of healing.

You can use a bonus action when casting a spell that heals. Choose one target that you can see within 20 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack against that target, if it hits the target takes damage equal to 1d6 plus your Intelligence modifier.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you regain uses on a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Archangel
entries: Starting at 18th level, as an action you grant yourself and any number of creatures (up to your Intelligence modifier) within 30 feet of you advantage on attack rolls and saving throws, and a bonus to damage and healing equal to your Intelligence modifier until the end of your next turn.

However, maintaining this flow of light and shadow is a terrible strain on the body. At the end of your next turn, you must suceed a Constitution Saving Throw DC 14 or gain a level of Exhaustion. You do not receive advantage on this Saving Throw. Regardless of the result, you may choose to maintain the effect or discontinue it.
Each round that you continue to hold the effects of Dark Archangel, the Constitution Saving Throw DC increases by 2 regardless of your success or failure on the previous Saving Throw.
Once you have used this ability, you may not use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow
entries: The Light in which many priests bathe is brilliant and effervescent, granting them immense divine power. But the brightest light casts the darkest shadow - and from within this blackness, a rival power dwells. Shadow priests fully embrace this opposing polarity, their faith equally resolute as their holy counterparts - but focused on shadowy magics and mental manipulation. Like all priests, they dedicate much of their lives to worship - but they derive their power from the Void, straying dangerously close to the domain of the Old Gods. To truly understand such ancient, corruptive influence is to be driven mad. This is the state in which these dark priests thrive, embracing insanity and feeding off of the minds of their opponents to reach terrifying new limits.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Discipline Spells
entries: Once you gain a discipline spell, you always have it prepared and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you have a discipline spell that doesn't appear on the priest spell list, the spell is nonetheless a priest spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Spike
entries: At first level, you can use a bonus action when casting a spell that does damage. Roll one additional damage die of the casted spell and add it as psychic damage. When you reach 11th level, roll two additional die. This feature can be used a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Covenant
entries: Being adept in the powers of the mind you are able to shape people's opinions and desicions to allign with your own. Starting at 2nd level, you become proficient in Insight and Persuasion. If you are already proficient in either, your proficiency bonus is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptive Mind
entries: Even the simplest physical techniques require a deep understanding of how ancestral magic can augment mind and body. This understanding allows you to alter your defenses to better deal with threats. Starting at 6th level, you can replace your proficiency in Intelligence saving throws whenever you finish a short or long rest. To do so, choose Strength, Dexterity, Wisdom, or Charisma. You gain proficiency in saves using that ability, instead of Intelligence. This change lasts until you finish your next short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mind's Edge
entries: As your devout powers grow in strength, you learn how to remain focused even when being attacked or wounded. Starting at 14th level, when concentrating on a spell, you may add your Intelligence modifier to the saving throw that dictates whether or not you can maintain concentration when being attacked.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Control
entries: At 18th level, you have learned the most important teaching of the shadowform: it's not how you use your power in a battle, it's how you use your adversary's power against them. You can use your reaction when you are targeted by a spell that deals damage to redirect it to the original caster. You must make a roll using your Intelligence modifier, to beat a DC of 10 + the level of the spell you're trying to redirect. The redirected spell's new point of origin is the original spell caster. If it had a saving throw, it uses your spell DC now, if it needs an attack roll, you make that roll with your spell attack. If the spell fails to redirect, you take additional psychic damage equal to the spell's damage die multiplied by half of the spell's level. You can only use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blood
entries: While the other disciplines of priest might favor light, shadow, or the divide between the two, the discipline of blood is quite different. The blood discipline focuses on the nature of the life essence of the various creatures of the world. A blood priest can alter and manipulate these essences, this blood, to the benefit of themselves and their allies. Blood priests often serve deities that others would consider strange or dark, however those that follow the blood discipline care not for the opinions of others, for theirs is a singular path that is not for the faint of heart.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Discipline Spells
entries: Once you gain a discipline spell, you always have it prepared and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you have a discipline spell that doesn't appear on the priest spell list, the spell is nonetheless a priest spell for you.

entries.caption: Blood Discipline Spells
rows: {@spell speak with the dead}, {@spell vampiric touch}

subclassFeature.name: Siphon Life
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain control over the flow of life within living beings. As an action, you can siphon the life essence from a living target. Choose one target within 30 feet, the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw DC 8 plus your Intelligence modifier plus your proficiency modifier or take necrotic damage equal to 1d6 plus your Intelligence modifier.
You gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.
Undead and constructs are immune to this ability.
You can use this ability once per short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Anatomical Study
entries: You have long studied the anatomy and behavior of various creatures. Starting at 2nd level, you become proficient in Nature and Medicine. If you are already proficient in either, your proficiency bonus is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Coagulate
entries: Starting at 6th level, you have learned how to convert life essence into usable Mana. Once per long rest you can spend 1 minute to convert half of your current temporary hit points (up to a maximum amount equal to your Intelligence modifier plus 1) into spell slots.
No spell slot restored may be higher than 5th level.
Additionally, you may not use this ability when you are poisoned, diseased, or exhausted.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Exchange
entries: Starting at 14th level, you have gained the ability to move your vitality to others. As an action, you may transfer any amount of your temporary hit points to an ally within 20 feet of you.
However, using this ability while poisoned, diseased, or exhausted transfers the effect from you to your target.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and you regain uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hemorrhage
entries: At 18th level, you have mastered the flow of life within those around you. Choose any number of targets (up to your Intelligence modifier) within 30 feet of you. The targets must succeed a Constitution saving throw DC 10 plus your Intelligence modifier plus your proficiency modifer or take 8d8 necrotic damage.

Calculate the total damage dealt, you may distribute an amount of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt to friendly targets within 20 feet of you. No target may receive more than 20 temporary hit points from this ability.

Additionally, targets damaged by this ability take an ongoing 1d4 necrotic damage for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier. This damage does not contribute to the temporary hit points you can distribute in any way.
You may use this ability once per long rest.

variantrule.name: Shadow Current
entries: Spoken of in hushed whispers wherever magic users gather, the Shadow Current is a strange and mysterious force that runs counter to the Aetherial Current. No one knows where or how the Shadow Current originated, but it is believed to have existed for several millennia, though its use has never become widespread.

entries.name: Using the Shadow Current
entries: The Shadow Current is best suited for magic that drains life, creates darkness, or muddles the mind and senses; but it is less suited for magics that manipulate energy or matter, provide healing, or create light.

When used to cast a spell from the schools of Enchantment, Illusion, or Necromancy the range of the spell is increased by one half, any Check or Save incurred by the spell has its DC increased by 2, and if the spell deals damage then its damage is increased by one die. However, when casting a spell from the schools of Evocation or Transmutation with the Shadow Current, the range of the spell is decreased by one half, any Check or Save incurred by the spell has its DC decreased by 2, and if the spell deals damage then its damage is decreased by one die to a minimum of one die.

When a spellcaster uses the Shadow Current to cast a spell that creates darkness, the size of the area of darkness created is also doubled. Additionally, these spells cannot be dispelled. The Shadow Current cannot be used to cast a spell that creates light under any circumstances.

When a spellcaster uses the Shadow Current to cast a spell that provides healing, half of the healing is applied normally and half of the healing is applied as Temporary Hit Points. Additionally, the recipient of the healing spell must make a Constitution Save DC 5 + the level of the spell cast on them + the total amount of healing provided to them, receiving a level of exhaustion on a failure.

Due to the nature of the Shadow Current, it is a separate force of magic. It is not affected by areas of dead or wild magic within the Aetheric Current. An anti-magic field however counters all magic within its area and that includes the Shadow Current and its wielders. Shadow Current spellcasters must overcome any resistances that a creature might have and their magics are still subject to damage immunities as well. It is also harder for a normal spellcaster to perceive, counter, or dispel spells created with the Shadow Current, but at the same time it is harder for a Shadow Current user to affect spells created using the Aetheric Current; any check made to perceive, counter, or dispel a spell with the opposing Current must be made at disadvantage. Any Magic Item created using the Shadow Current is a Shadow Current item and therefore affected and subject to the same benefits and limitations as a Shadow Current spell.
